story:
An Introduction

My name is Jani Clark.  I am passionate about the environment and making my family's life better.  We live in central Maine, raising gardens, chickens and preparing for winter.  As a single mom on a tight budget, striving for a graceful balance between efficiency and harmony with the environment, I recognize there are areas for improvement in my understanding of the land.

This November, I would like to take a class in Permaculture Design at a school here in New England.  With this six month long class, I will learn to make better use of the land I have and work with instead of against nature.  In addition I will be able to help my community in this way as well. 

By supporting me, it will help me transform our lives.

Here's the Details

My goal is $1800 with $1095 going for the class and the balance going for Indiegogo fees and for gas to and from the class that will take place about 100 miles from my house.  The classes meet 12 times, so with gas prices what they are, it adds up quickly. 

For those who help me achieve this goal, there are a number of handmade items offered.  There are a personal email from me for those who want to recycle electrons, a handmade thank you card or a handwritten copy of my dad's decadent "Bread & Butter Custard", which is a rich take on bread pudding. And if you are local, a consult on permaculture design when I am finished or a locavore meal made in your home!  If you are not local, a matching pair of handmade potholders or handmade quilted wall hanging.

If my goal is not reached, then I will use the money to further my Permaculture education in other ways by taking a shorter course or choosing a specialty area to focus upon. 

Before You Leave

If you cannot contribute or if you do contribute, please share this by using the Indiegogo tools.  Thank you for reading this and many blessings on you and yours.

story:
I am a 16 year old nerd living in Edinburgh. I am studying Advanced Maths and Biology. I am studying Chemistry, and Physics and Business too.

There are no Scottish astronauts, there is not even a Scottish Space Agency, so my chances of doing much here in Scotland are quite limited.

I've seen articles from around the world (especially in America) about students sending weather balloons to the edge of space, and I would like to become one of them.

To do this, I need to buy weather balloons, cameras, parachutes and all kinds of other equipment. And a lot of helium too.

That's where you come in.

Being 16 years old and in full-time education, it would take me an extraordinarily long time to earn this money alone, and the UK being in a recession doesn't exactly help!

So I'm reaching out to you on the Internet to help.

If just 600 people donate $6 I will be able to achieve my dream and all it will cost you is the price of a burger.
story_txt:
I am a 16 year old nerd living in Edinburgh. I am studying Advanced Maths and Biology. I am studying Chemistry, and Physics and Business too.
There are no Scottish astronauts, there is not even a Scottish Space Agency, so my chances of doing much here in Scotland are quite limited.
I've seen articles from around the world (especially in America) about students sending weather balloons to the edge of space, and I would like to become one of them.
To do this, I need to buy weather balloons, cameras, parachutes and all kinds of other equipment. And a lot of helium too.
That's where you come in.
Being 16 years old and in full-time education, it would take me an extraordinarily long time to earn this money alone, and the UK being in a recession doesn't exactly help!
So I'm reaching out to you on the Internet to help.
If just 600 people donate $6 I will be able to achieve my dream and all it will cost you is the price of a burger.

story:
There are 400 municipal slaughterhouses in Nicaragua and only one of them treats its waste. The rest, including the one in Bluefields, pour the waste into ravines and waterways, creating a true environmental and health crisis.

In 2010, blueEnergy launched an initiative to address this contamination issue as well as address the energy needs at the facility. The project was also designed to improve the quality of the meat produced and strengthen the local productive agricultural system through the use of high-nutrient bi-products of the biodigestor process. The project includes an initiative to create a municipal business that will sell bio-fertilizers to help contribute to the financial stability of the slaughterhouse. The project has massive impact potential at the local level, but also at the regional and national level, as it can serve as a model for the other 400 slaughter houses to resolve their environmental, health and energy crises while contributing positively to local agriculture.

blueEnergy started working in 2010 with several stakeholders including the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) and the Municipal Government of Bluefields, to initiate a series of preliminary studies for the project. Subsequent planning stages saw the involvement of the Ministry of Energy, the United Nations Development Program and the UPOLI technical university in Managua.

In the early stages of the project, the Municipal Government took action to improve the infrastructure in the area, better organize the processing of the animals and implement proper health and sanitation controls. In parallel to this, blueEnergy began working on the designs for the biodigestor system that will: 1) treat the animal waste and produce an organic fertilizer in the process, 2) produce methane gas to boil water for animal processing and 3) produce methane gas to run an electric generator for the facility.

We broke ground on the biodigestor in February and are 6-8 weeks and $10,000 away from completing it. WITH YOUR GENEROUS SUPPORT, we can complete this game-changing project and improve the health of 50,000 people by transforming how meat and waste are processed in the region.

Once the project is completed it will be owned and operated by the Municipal Government. Using a public-private partnership model, a social enterprise will be created to run a business selling the 400+ gallons of liquid fertilizer produced by the biodigestor per day when running at full capacity. This sustainable activity will support local agriculture and ranching and reduce the need for petroleum imports.

Alongside your support blueEnergy is fortunate to have the support of the United Nations Development Program (UNDP), the Municipal Government of Bluefields, the Ministry of Energy and Mines, Noble Energy and the Lord Michelham Foundation to make this vital, model project a reality.

Project pictures are available here:

https://picasaweb.google.com/blueEnergyMedia/Bi...

story:
EARTHWIDEWALK:

VUELTA AL MUNDO A PIE

5 años.

5 continentes.

50.000 kilómetros.

“Marcha mundial por la naturaleza y el planeta Tierra”

¿QUÉ ES EARTHWIDEWALK?

EARTHWIDEWALK es una campaña única en la historia: una vuelta al mundo a pie en solitario y en autosuficiencia, atravesando los cinco continentes y con una duración aproximada de 5 años, lanzando un mensaje de conservación y respeto por la naturaleza y el planeta Tierra, nuestra hermosa casa. Todo un reto de resistencia física y fortaleza mental.

OBJETIVOS DEL PROYECTO

Tratar de concienciar de la urgente necesidad de cambiar unos hábitos y estilos de vida que están explotando el planeta muy por encima de sus posibilidades (contaminación, aceleración del cambio climático, destrucción de ecosistemas, extinción de especies…), reflexionar sobre el legado que queremos dejar y las condiciones de vida que queremos para nosotros mismos en el presente.

Contar una historia de superación, coraje y valentía y apostar por un mundo mejor, demostrar que no hay nada imposible ni más límites que aquellos que nosotros queramos asumir, y que está en nuestras manos crear la realidad. Un proyecto de todos y para todos. Porque las personas somos la energía que movemos el mundo.

¿CÓMO ESTAMOS CONSIGUIENDO ESTOS OBJETIVOS?

De la manera más efectiva posible, mediante el ejemplo, caminando diariamente (entre 40 y 50 kilómetros diarios), siendo esta la manera ecológica y respetuosa de transporte que existe con el medio-ambiente.

Difundiendo esta aventura mediante internet (blog y redes sociales), reportando mediante fotografías y vídeos la belleza del mundo en el que vivimos y el estado de los diferentes ecosistemas que voy atravesando.

Divulgando este maravilloso mensaje de superación y coraje mediante entrevistas en los medios de comunicación de todo el mundo tanto locales (donde transcurre la marcha) como internacionales (mediante teléfono o correo) haciendo de este un mensaje y un proyecto sin fronteras.

Dando charlas en colegios de ciudades y pueblos por los que transcurre la marcha, deteniéndome a colaborar con otras iniciativas que trabajan por el medio-ambiente.

Escribiendo un libro que se publicará al finalizar esta odisea.

FINANCIACIÓN

Si donas a este proyecto estarás haciendo historia, y tendrás la satisfacción de ayudar a materializar una campaña sin igual y a difundir su mensaje.

5.000 euros son necesarios para llevar esta gesta a buen puerto, pues la mayoría de los fondos salen de mi propio bolsillo, pero es una empresa de larga duración con gran cantidad de gastos y, a pesar de que voy rozando la supervivencia, no alcanzo a cubrir el presupuesto mínimo estimado.

EARTHWIDEWALK YA ESTÁ HACIÉNDOSE REALIDAD

Además, el proyecto ya está en marcha: tuvo comienzo el pasado 21 de marzo de 2013 desde el kilómetro 0 de la Puerta del Sol en Madrid (España) y al día de hoy me encuentro en Nepal tras más de más de 10.000 kilómetros recorridos, 9 meses de caminata y 13 países en mis piernas: España, Francia, Italia, Eslovenia, Croacia, Serbia, Bulgaria, Turquía, Georgia, Armenia, Irán, India y Nepal.

Esto ha supuesto...

Caminar una media de más de 40 kilómetros diarios.

Empujando un carrito donde llevo todas mis pertenencias (más de 40 kg de peso).

Realizando el 95% del trayecto en soledad y autosuficiencia.

Para que te hagas una idea... ha ido más gente a la luna que personas que han dado la vuelta al mundo a pie. Una aventura donde se pone al límite las condiciones tanto físicas como mentales.

TOMA ACCIÓN AHORA Y FORMA PARTE DE ESTE MARAVILLOSO PROYECTO

EarthWideWalk comienza como un sueño en pos de inspirar a otras personas a respetar más la naturaleza y el medio-ambiente. Mensaje que viene avalado mediante el ejemplo físico de superación diaria, caminando día a día y demostrando que un mundo mejor es posible.

Es por eso que veo imprescindible que formes parte de este maravilloso y único proyecto que une el ejemplo de una persona que lucha día tras día por aquello en lo que cree y quiere difundir un mensaje claro, hacer de este un mundo mejor.

Es el momento perfecto para apoyar proyectos como EarthWideWalk, muchas gracias por tu aportación y nos vemos en el blog y las redes sociales.

¡Este es tu momento!

**************************************************

EARTHWIDEWALK:

WALK AROUND THE WORLD ON FOOT

5 years.

5 continents.

50,000 miles.

"World March for nature and the planet Earth"

WHAT IS EARTHWIDEWALK?

EARTHWIDEWALK is a unique campaign in history, a walk around the world alone and self-sufficiency, all over five continents, in approximately five years, sending a message of conservation and respect for nature and the planet Earth, our beautiful home. Quite a challenge of physical endurance and mental toughness.

PROJECT OBJECTIVES

Trying to awareness of the urgent need to change habits and lifestyles that are exploiting the planet (pollution, accelerating climate change, ecosystem destruction, species extinction...), thinking about the legacy we want leave and the conditions of life we ​​want for ourselves in the present.

Telling a story of overcoming, courage and bravery and go for a better world, to show that nothing is impossible any further than the limits that we want to take, and that is in our power to create reality. A project of all and for all. Because people are the energy that moves the world.

HOW WE ARE GETTING THESE GOALS?

In the most effective way possible, by the example, walking in daily basis (between 40 and 50 miles a day), this being the ecological and respectful way of transportation that exists with the environment.

Spreading this adventure through internet (blog and social networks), reporting through photographs and videos the beauty of the world we live in and the status of the different ecosystems that I'm going through.

Disclosing this wonderful message of resilience and courage through interviews in the media worldwide both local (where the march passes) and international (by phone or mail) making this project universal.

Giving talks at schools in cities and towns through the march, stopping to collaborate with other initiatives that work for the environment.

Writing a book to be published by the end of this odyssey .

FINANCING

If you donate to this project you will be making history, and you'll have the satisfaction of helping to realize unparalleled campaign and spread their message.

5,000 euros are needed to bring to complete the proyect, most of the founds are from my own pocket, but it is a long standing proyect with a lot of expenses and, although survival lifestyle, I'm trying to cover the estimated minimum budget.

EARTHWIDEWALK ALREADY BECOMING REALITY

In addition, the project is already underway: had started last March 21, 2013 from kilometer 0 of the Puerta del Sol in Madrid (Spain) and today I am in Nepal after more than 10,000 kilometers traveled, 9 months of walking and 13 countries on my legs: Spain, France, Italy, Slovenia, Croatia, Serbia, Bulgaria, Turkey, Georgia, Armenia, Iran, India and Nepal.

This has led...

Walking an average of over 40 miles a day.

Pushing a cart where I have all my belongings (over 40 kg).

Making 95% of the journey in solitude and self-sufficiency.

To give you an idea... more people has gone to the moon that people who have done a walk on foot around the world. An adventure where the limit of physical and mental conditions are so rought.

TAKE ACTION NOW AND BE PART OF THIS WONDERFUL PROJECT

EarthWideWalk begins as a dream to inspire others to respect more the nature and environment. Message that is supported by physical example of overcoming daily obstacles, walking and showing that a better world is possible.

That's why I see must become part of this wonderful and unique project that unites the example of a person who fights every day for what he believes and wants to spread a clear message, make this a better world.

It is the perfect place to support projects like EarthWideWalk, thank you very much for your donation and we will see in the blog and social networks .

This is your moment!

**************************************************

story:
[Use the four-corner icon to watch the video full screen.]

Our Story

We are Paul Edwards and Lanny Cotler, ex-Hollywood writers/directors who after successful careers decided that instead of engaging in marginally effective blogging, we'd use the power and appeal of the visual to reach a wider audience and potentially have a far greater impact. Together we formed ClassWarFilms. 

Our purpose in "American Inspiration" is to show the stranglehold the System of predatory capitalism has put on truth, honor and integrity. One of its most destructive efforts has been subversion and co-opting of the wilderness advocacy movement by Big Money.  Failure to protect the last of the wild in America means irreparable loss of essential biodiversity and wanton destruction of the web of life.

 


Our documentary will show the vital necessity of wilderness preservation to humanity and all life, how advocacy for it was sold out and betrayed, and the way we can fight together to make the movement live again.

What We Need & What You Get

What we have is bare bones professional equipment and the drive, energy, and ability to go where we have to go to get the story we want to tell.

What we need is your support for the editing, post-production, and marketing.  We have the work handled, but we can't do a serious marketing and distribution job without your help.  We've raised $5,000 but still need about $25,000 to cover what we've done, what we're doing, and for the greater expense we'll incur in meeting and dealing directly with potential exhibitors.

Donors at modest levels will get boxed DVDs of the documentary.  Larger donors names will appear in the end credits if they wish.  All funds go into our production.


The Impact

The horrifying reality of the scale of human-caused degradation of the environment is becoming evident, and people are realizing that the fragile balance that enables life on Earth as we know it is in critical jeopardy. 

The glaciers are melting, the rain forests sacrificed, the oceans fouled, the air poisoned, and world temperatures are rising off the charts.  In the face of all this disaster the preservation of the purity, viability, and sanctity of what remains becomes not just important, but vital. 

Loss of the remaining wild will mean the end of all life in any meaningful sense.

With this project we have turned away from focusing our work on political and financial chaos and dysfunction in America to the yet larger concern of defending the basis and the means of life itself.  Thoreau said it: "In wildness is the preservation of the world." We now know that this is literally true. 

In this documentary we mean to bring that message home to this country.

Check our other videos to see the quality of the work we do.

http://www.youtube.com/user/ClassWarFilms


Risks & Challenges

The one risk we face is not having the resources to secure a market that will give our documentary a national audience. There's no guarantee that a capitalist media market will welcome a message that openly attacks mendacity and blind greed.

We will use every contact and follow every lead to find the media outlets that have the vision to give our piece the national audience it deserves.   We feel confident that our video will be so strong that we can "make them an offer they can't refuse."

There is the risk that the organizations that most people believe are protecting the wilderness will mount a campaign against the documentary's indictment of their perfidy and betrayal.  We can live with that.  We welcome their antagonism. 

No one is making a video like this. No one else has faced the facts and put the pieces  together to lay out the mortal threat to the last wild heart of our country.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    For those who believe in what we're doing but can't assist financially, you can be of tremendous help in spreading the word to those who might be able to participate.  

    We urge you to reach out to others who will resonate with our purpose. 

    Indiegogo, one of the best crowdfunding portals, has a number of "share tools" to help you engage your family, friends, and colleagues. Please check them out.

    Think about the supreme value of true untrammeled wilderness—not just to human beings, but to the planet and life itself. Then share that vision with those who care.

    ~ PE & LC

story:
Background: 

Friends for Conservation and Development (FCD) is a non-profit, non-governmental organization based in Belize in the Cayo District. FCD is the only non–governmental organization with an assertive management presence in the Chiquibul Forest, representing 7.7% of the national territory. Day to day, the primary work of FCD, with its partners including the Forest Department, Institute of Archaeology, Belize Defence Force and the Police, has been to maintain the integrity of natural and cultural resources of the Chiquibul Forest.

The importance of the Chiquibul Forest to Belize : 

  1. About 400,000 acres of rich biodiversity, wildlife, timber and home to the largest cave system in Central America and to the Caracol Archaeological Site 
  2. The Chiquibul Forest comprises the Caracol Mayan Site, the The Chiquibul National Park and the Chiquibul Forest Reserve
  3. It provides water to over 40% of the Belize population 
  4. It is the largest cachement area of rainfall which is critical to the provision/generation  of electricity in the country 
  5. Friends of Conservation and Development (FCD) is a small group of dedicated committed Belizeans who risk their lives each day in protecting and conserving this vast natural resource
  6. The video link explains the working environment of the rangers.  http://youtu.be/bu6ypeooI5U
The Chiquibul Park Rangers : 

The FCD Park Rangers do the day to day monitoring and research within this vast forest area (about 4x the size of Barbados)  and provide critical data to the regulatory agencies including the BDF, Police, Forest Department and other authorities about the state of the environment and extent of incursions and encroachments against our natural resources and our sovereignty.

Why Donate to the Adopt A Ranger Program: 

Your donation will help to put more park rangers on the ground for FCD.   With a cadre of park rangers, FCD can provide better monitoring coverage of the area and allow for a more effective rotation of its rangers to patrol the area and collect data.  FCD works every year on grant proposals which are primarily granted and approved for office equipment, research work, upgrade to park and research facilities.   Your donation  will help in maintaining and improving its ranger program.  This demonstration of support also will help in future grant proposals for FCD .

story: I will be traveling to Nicaragua to volunteer with Give Volunteers. The money will help pay for program fee's, my plane tickets, travel insurance, vaccinations, and other costs for the trip! (Taken Directly From Gives Website) Our current volunteer initiatives in Nicaragua focus on constructing and repairing schools using innovative, eco-friendly constructions techniques, teaching English, and helping to restore ecosystems. Help give me a chance to make the world a better place! Even $1 Will help!

story:
Since 2005, the Sonshine Philippines Movement (SPM) — a registered non-profit in the Philippines (SEC Reg. No. CN200529947) — and its volunteers have made it our mission to be protectors/restorers of the earth and movers of positive change.

We believe (as discussed in one of the United Nation's forums a few years ago) that the indigenous peoples should be empowered to be guardians of nature. However, their current circumstances cannot allow them to be so.

The Dumagat are among the indigenous peoples who gravely need our help.

Most of them being uneducated and neck-deep in poverty, they are unable to defend and protect their ancestral lands. Many are even subjected to discrimination from people who take advantage of their circumstances and ignorance.

To the Dumagat, basic necessities like salt or soap are already luxuries they are barely able to afford.

This Dumagat Outreach and Sierra Madre Greening Project is intended to change that.


How we can make a difference...


By implementing programs to uplift the lives of the Dumagat people, we can empower them to take an active role in protecting and restoring the environment — particularly the natural forest ecosystems in their ancestral lands located in the Sierra Madre mountain ranges in the Philippines.


Your contribution will fund the following...


(1) We will teach and help the Dumagat establish and manage a sustainable reforestation (forest farm) project (approximately 24,000 hectares) in their ancestral lands which will yield ecological and carbon sequestration benefits to fight climate change and at the same time, provide a good source of income to the Dumagat farmers.

(2) Educational assistance for the Dumagat children. Aside from their basic education, we want to put emphasis on their culture and heritage so they will grow up into responsible citizens who appreciate their roots and understand not only the importance of protecting and restoring the environment but also act on it.

(3) Environmental workshops to teach and educate the Dumagat families on how to protect and preserve the environment – particularly their ancestral domains – in these modern times.

Target Start Date of Project Implementation: January 2015

We will be posting videos and photos on the "Updates" tab above to report progress, plus we will be airing the videos via SMNI World TV.


The challenges...


Change is rarely easy. This is true even to the Dumagat people. While many Dumagat families are open and eager to be a part of these programs, there are some who may be hesitant and would rather go on as they are already accustomed to.

To ensure the success of the project, we will carefully select the families who are willing to be a part of the program with the help of the Dumagat chieftains, local government unit, Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) and National Commission on Indigenous Peoples (NCIP).


Other ways you can help...


Please share this link http://www.spm.ph/dumagat/ to your family and friends.


Learn more about the Sonshine Philippines Movement (SPM)...


SPM and its volunteers thank you for supporting our cause. To learn more about us and our previous projects, please visit our website at http://www.spm.ph/.

SPM is a registered non-profit in the Philippines with SEC Reg. No. CN200529947.

For inquiries, you may send us an email at info@spm.ph.

story: My name is Amy Cabrera and about a year ago I started my own business designing a women's clothing line. As I worked on this business a story about a little girl ,named Grace, was brought to my attention. Grace lived in Nairobi, Africa with her mom and sister on dirt floors and a house the size of a bathroom. She and her sister had been out looking for jobs every day until they got in contact with an agency.  This agency promised Grace a passport, free plane ticket, a job in Saudi Arabia and lastly they would send the money she earned back to her family. My friend Jamie, who shared the story with me, decided to check this agency out for herself since sex trafficking is rampant in their area. After catching the traffickers in numerous lies and no direct contact info where Grace would be working, she decided it would not be safe to go. Grace explained the situation to her mother and was told that she was selfish and needs to go back in the morning to beg for her job back. Grace went to the agency the next day, was given one phone call to say goodbye to her sister and has been missing since 2012. The Saving Grace Project is currently a pending 501C3 non profit. I am going to Nairobi in May 2015 to visit the girls in the city and choose five to start the project with.  They desperately need jobs with consistent pay and once they reach the age many girls already expressed a desire to attend college and funds raised will help pay their tuition. While I am there I will observe them and their community and set up jobs that will be a benefit to both. I need  to raise $34,000 to begin this process and meet their needs.  Lastly, I went on a research trip to London and Greece April of 2014. During this trip we visited A-21 an anti trafficking organization in Europe and learned how difficult, twisted and complicated sex trafficking really is. The things I learned about and witnessed is life changing. Girls as young as 11 are lied to and abused until they are mentally broken.  Trafficking operations are all over the world and spreading quickly. How they choose their victims is down to a science from specific personality traits to being poor, jobless and unwanted. The best thing to do is provide work and education for potential victims.  I want to do both for my five girls and will add many more. You can read Grace's full story at www.lotticlothing.com  the information is under The SG Project.

story:
We believe wild places matter. They represent our loftiest ideals and demand our greatest humility. The American decision to preserve wilderness showed that as a nation we could value places for their own sake, and not just for the value of the resources contained within them. In wilderness we recognize something in our past that forged us as a nation, and something in the future that forms us as individuals.  

Wilderness is also a place for transformation within the human spirit. In solitude we find ourselves challenged and grounded. We see beyond our needs and wants, and recognize our place in the world.

Wilderness is the ‘why’ behind what we do at Southern Appalachian Wilderness Stewards (SAWS). It is the anchor in our name, and in our mission.

What we do is to preserve the wilderness while protecting access for those that seek the rewards of being ‘out there’. We stand behind the preservation of places and experiences, sharing the foundation of the movement while supporting the ecologic, economic and social dynamics that public lands provide to our communities.  We do this work so that you, and those yet to come, can share in these places and this great idea.

Through the efforts of the staff, volunteers and partners that make up the SAWS community we are keeping trails open to provide access that leads to connections, personal health and community economic development. We are educating a new public about the foundation of public commons, and in doing so preserving the wilderness experience. Through partnership and innovation, we are building a community of stewards to stand behind, and for, wild places in the decades to come.

In 2017 the team at SAWS responded to storms and opportunities alike. We employed over 35 young people to serve as stewards, serving on Wilderness Field Crews, as Wilderness Rangers or as educators and place-based interpreters. Through the work of these young professionals we connected with tens of thousands of visitors to your public lands, cleared over 3,000 trees that had fallen across trails and restricted access, rebuilt trails that were failing, and changed hearts and minds for the benefit of wild places. Through our volunteers and staff, we were able to educate, cultivate and empower new partners for public lands.

The training partnership known as the Wilderness Skills Institute had its biggest year ever in 2017, and we grew our Wilderness Leadership Crew with the United States Naval Academy. We launched new endeavors in training and hiring with the Job Corps Centers across North Carolina, and established new service-based partnerships with universities and non-profit organizations from Georgia to Virginia.

The staff and volunteers that have come through our community are launching careers and movements, with alumni leading work in National Parks, National Forests and with great conservation organizations here in the southeast and across the nation. We are leading, and we are creating leaders!

As we peak across the holidays to the year to come, we see challenges – but we also see great opportunity. We want you to join us in rising to the challenges and maximizing the opportunities to move more Americans to not only revel in the gift of wilderness, but to serve our wild lands through service.

In 2018 we will build upon the 20,000+ hours of stewardship we provided public lands in 2017. We will be engaging in new partnerships to reach audiences in both urban and rural communities across Southern Appalachia, making wild places reachable for those disconnected from these commons that belong to all of us. Our geographic reach will be expanding in 2018 to include to wilds of Kentucky and West Virginia, and our programming will expand to further emphasize the need to keep wild places wild for generations yet to come.

With your help we can grow our;

  • Wilderness Field Crews – improving access and providing employment for future conservation leaders
  • Wilderness Ranger Program – educating the public and preserving the wild through public contact
  • United States Naval Academy Leadership Crew – connecting American leadership to public lands
  • Green Spaces to Wild Places Campaign – designed to connect urban youth to their public land future
  • Wilderness Values Campaign – expanding our reach to communities surrounding our Southern Appalachian wilderness – demonstrating the economic, ecologic and social values of the special places
  • Capacity – rising to meet increasing threats to wilderness character while preserving access

 We hope you will join our $10,000 campaign here at the end of 2017 to help us raise $40,000 before the end December to kick-off another great year for the wild!

  • Your contribution of $100 would help us clear a dozen trees from the trails
  • Your contribution of $250 supplies a Crew Member with their back-country gear
  • Your contribution of $500 provides a Crew Member a week of employment

story:
Summary

Endangered baleen whales -- including the fin whale, second largest animal on earth -- have begun reinvading the temperate fjords of British Columbia's north coast, where they forage intensively and socialize, just as a suite of oil and natural gas tanker routes have been proposed for the area. We must rush to document this unprecedented concentration of inland whales before any impacts from maritime development can take effect. 

As a PhD student at Scripps Institution of Oceanography, I have devoted my dissertation to learning more about the whales of the Great Bear before that opportunity is lost. In summer 2013, I conducted four months of visual, acoustic, and oceanographic surveys within a broad transect of the northern fjords aboard my 12m research sloop, the SV Bangarang. I now have a proof of concept for this project, a fine-tuned survey design, preliminary data, and some remarkable stories. I now need the means of getting back out there for Season Two. 


Impact

Academic: This is a project in pure discovery. Many aspects of this remote fjordland's ecosystem are poorly studied, and BC is the only place fin whales have been studied in a fjord setting.  As baleen whale populations continue to recover from 20th century whaling, how and to what extent will they come to rely on this habitat? Conversely, what is the potential importance of these whales to the ecological function of BC's north coast?

Applied: My research will provide a baseline for the pre-tanker ecology of their habitat, as well as a basis for mitigating possible impacts. These remarkable inland whale populations are facing developments that would impact economies -- both human and natural -- across North America. This remote sanctuary is now of public concern, and to study them I am looking for public support. 

Personal: It may be a rare thing that a PhD project is also a dream come true. I am unbelievably fortunate that I have found such a project, and I'm on fire about it. I can’t wait to get back out there. 


Needs

I've designed my project to be high-impact at low-cost.  For a full season (4 months) of PhD-level ecosystem research on the SV Bangarang, my budget is less than that of operating a Scripps research vessel for half a day. Unfortunately, as a PhD student operating my own research vessel, my project falls between the cracks of small student grants and large post-doctoral grants. 

Barebones Needs: $10,000

For Season Two to happen at all, this minimum would cover the cost of fuel, food for three crew, and a few essential pieces of equipment.

High-Value Improvements: An additional $20,000.

In addition to these necessities, there are some small investments that would substantially improve the quality, consistency, and impact of the data I collect. These include:

  • Engine replace/rebuild: In 2013, we lost several weeks of critical research days to repairing the SV Bangarang's 33-year old 45 hp diesel. Improving the reliability of our vessel is the single-most effective change I could make for 2014. 
  • Travel assistance for crew: The crew of the Bangarang are some of the most dedicated, enthusiastic, and hard-working researchers I know, and they fight for this project without pay or compensation. As a meager thanks, I want to cover their travel expenses to and from the remote study site in 2014.
  • Equipment Improvements: Specific items that will allow us to sample farther, deeper, longer, and more precisely than in season one. These include: A motorized line hauler to increase the number of zooplankton tows we can take;  back-up underwater microphones so that we don't become paralyzed by equipment breakdown; a raised sighting platform for visual surveys; a net and imaging system that allows us to sample for phytoplankton. 


Overhead: An additional $5,000 to cover Indiegogo fees, third-party payment service charges, and UCSD overhead costs. No support will go towards salaries, wages, or non-business-related expenses.

Regardless of whether I reach my fundraising mark, all support I receive will go a long, long way in making Season Two happen. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word and stay informed. Word of mouth, email, fb, twitter, Indiegogo's share tools, improvised songs, sky-writing, human statues, whatever!

All photographs are by crew of the SV Bangarang, with the exception of the "Summary" photo (vessel with the two fin whales) by Janie Wray, North Coast Cetacean Society.

story:
Cat Boyd is standing to be an MSP in this year’s Scottish election as RISE: Scotland’s Left Alliance's lead candidate on the Glasgow Regional List.

Whether it is leading a strike against bad bosses, organising a protest against misogynist Roosh V and his supporters, or speaking up for a socialist vision for an independent Scotland, Cat is widely known as a dedicated grassroots campaigner who is not afraid to speak her mind.


The Scottish Parliament doesn’t need more of the same – it needs radical campaigners willing to shake it up. Cat’s weekly column in The National, which she uses to be a tribune of the oppressed and marginalised in Scotland and beyond, is a taster of what she could bring to Holyrood.

Cat’s lived in Glasgow her entire adult life, knows and loves the city and her track record as a shop steward and a trade union organiser shows she will be a passionate and determined advocate for Glaswegians in the Scottish Parliament.

Scotland’s biggest city has shameful levels of homelessness, poverty and unemployment – we need someone who will do more than just speak warm words about these problems. We need a fighter, who will use her platform to raise up the voices of those being ignored by the powerful and help organise people to resist.


If elected, Cat will take a workers wage – the average wage of workers in Scotland – because she believes that to be a real representative of the people, means to experience the same living standards that they do.


Glasgow has a proud history of electing campaigning socialists, whether it be James Maxton or Mary Barbour. Cat stands in that tradition.

RISE has no big money backers – everything we spend on leaflets, posters, videos and adverts to get Cat elected will be donated from people like you to allow us to develop a truly grassroots campaign. Please give generously, and help elect Cat Boyd for Glasgow.

To find out more about what RISE stands for, visit rise.scot.

story:
My Story

     The year I was born in 1983, my father, "Bob" was recognized for selling over 1,000,000 gallons of fuel. He worked for Texaco and then BP selling their fuel for over 20 years.  I personally worked at his Amoco starting at the age of 13 and continued working after it was transformed into a BP.  I endured 9 long years behind the Gas Station Register, Completing High school, Fulfilling Military duties,  Destroying College, and Creating all of my Art used to fuel this Project


     BP's Product is NOT sustainable. With the average station owner making 1-2Â¢ per gallon, Bob could not Sustain his Family under the Rent of these bosses. He purchased a Bed and Breakfast in Vermont on April 20, 2007 and set the Inn up to be a more Self Sufficient, Sustainable Business. He received Legal Rights to the Inn's Name "Red Oak" on April 19, 2008, 1 year later.  Less than 3 months After restoring the dilapidated, GrandFathered in Relic of a Deli adjacent to the Inn, Bob passed away January 29, 2009, from a Heart Attack.


     I started a Year Long Fund-Raising Project on April 20, 2011; the Birthday of The Red Oak.  With your Help, We will plant 1,000,000 Trees, in Memory of Robert Lewis Buehler, which will be planted Globally with Maryland based Non-Profit TREES FOR THE FUTURE.


-I want people to remember my Father, the 4/20 BP Oil Spill and Think: Where Are We and Why?! 


The Impact

     We will plant 1,000,000 Trees in 5 different countries with Trees for the Future. "Be Heady" is focusing Tree Planting Efforts in India, Honduras, Haiti, Belize, and Senegal.  These countries in Need Have been Agriculturally Devastated Due to Natural and Man Induced Environmental Disasters.  The cost per tree is 10Â¢.  It only takes $400 to start a Village.  The people in these communities do not even have the tools to dig/water/create Life for themselves;

What We Need & What You Get

     The cost per tree is 10Â¢.  It ONLY takes $400 to start a Village!!!  I will split the Donations Evenly amongst the 5 Countries I am Helping.  To Date, we Have PLanted over 50,000 Trees with OUR Efforts.  100% of PROCEEDS WILL BE DONATED!!!


~Donate $100: I will send you an "I <3 Music" Sticker (50 Available)

~Donate $400: Start A Village: Receive a "Fe-Lion Fury" Custom Vinyl Sticker  (50 Available)

~Donate $1000: Fund Multiple Villages! I will MaKE you an Original "Share This World" Embroidered Jacket Backing Patch (5 Available)

 ~Tree Planting Donations Greatly Appreciated~
All Donations go to: Trees for the Future; 501 (c) 3 Tax-Exempt Non-Profit Organization


Other Ways You Can Help

     ~WE NEED YOUR HELP SPREADING the SEEDS of LOVE!! 

~Please SHARE using Social Media (Facebook, Myspace, Twitter)

~VISIT www.BEHEADY.com~

Through Art Sales and Donations; We will Direct Energy to Support Devastated Countries I have visited & whose Tree Growth Has a Direct Impact 
on the Quality of Our Lives:

story:
Our Story

The story begins with a young girl named Pacha who longs for the ocean and forest beyond the polluted city she lives in. Her dreams are the only way to imagine a different world. After receiving a new pair of pajamas that her mother made, she goes to sleep and dreams of the biggest concert ever on planet earth! From singing carrots to breakdancing dolphins, the species of the earth come together in this huge festival of all beings. And yet, no humans were invited. 

What is "Pacha's Pajamas" all about?

“Pacha’s Pajamas” is an edutainment platform that brings alive the voice of nature at a critical time for the planet. Through nature’s eye view and comical renditions of nature’s voices, we tell a story about how humanity is affecting the millions of other species and ecological systems and how each of us can change this story. Animating the voices of nature with music and humor allows much greater latitude in the urgency of this message and expands the potential for collective action. Connecting a global advocacy campaign such as Nature’s Rights to this type of platform opens up major market potential for ecological content in the entertainment industry.

Why is a story like "Pacha's Pajamas" so important?

At this moment of great peril and opportunity, the world is waking up to the power of story. Organizations of all forms are beginning to intentionally use story as a way to express their values and thereby emotionally connect with customers and constituencies. Because stories are the most accessible mode of values expression, shared story or (narrative) is the heart of collective action. If organizations and people can create joint narratives, we can start working together at an entirely new level.  And that is exactly what we need right now - humanity needs to sober up to the reality of limits and use them as creative constraints that define contours of the solutions we dream into reality. 

Who We Are

We are edutainers. Our aim is to leverage edutainment to help catalyze a shift in human consciousness whereby we work together to repair our relations with Mother Earth and each other. We see incredible potential in an emergent story called Pacha’s Pajamas about nature uniting to bring balance to a planet in turmoil. We think that children and adults alike will be better able to embrace the reality of our situation if it comes from the mouths of animals and plants, includes humor, and has a popular music inspired soundscape. And that’s what we do.

Our Vision

We invite you to join us in amplifying this story so that it is heard around the world - in living rooms, in classrooms, in playhouses, in bedrooms in auditoriums, in theaters, in nature - in all the places people come together to dream possible futures. With your participation, we can live this dream together.

The Impact

This is the first edutainment platform of its kind that propels the voices of Nature into pop culture, using hip hop music and cultural references to amplify these stories of species and ecosystems and make them culturally relevant for urban youth. The platform can be used to support a wide variety of social justice and environmental sustainability movements including climate justice and nature’s rights, most of which are in dire need of mechanisms to broaden and deepen their supporters. The story itself is about humanity awakening to understand that nature is very much alive and exhorts humanity to change its ways. The benefits of our products are that they are aligned with youth culture, awaken a new consciousness in the reader, and provide a low pressure avenue for youth and their parents to get activated for positive change. Our products offer humor, awakening to our new reality, and education about nature, and at the same time create many revenue streams.

Our objectives are:
  • To develop a robust edutainment platform that raises the unheard voices of the natural world in popular culture and public opinion
  • To popularize the advocacy campaign for global acceptance of the Bill of Rights for Nature with youth, people of color, and mainstream audiences
  • To empower youth and their loved ones to build resilient and equitable communities through the power of storytelling, multi-media and the arts.

On Mother’s Day (May 8th, 2011), we are releasing "Pacha’s Pajamas" as an eBook with beautiful sketch art. Several branded eBook versions will also be released in collaboration with partners. For the branded eBooks, we integrate the organization’s branding, campaign, and links into the ebook. For example, the cover would have the organization’s logo and the first page could be a “foreword” from the organization. Following the story is a section for the organization’s campaign with a call to action that links to a web site. The organization can distribute the branded eBook however they see fit.

This is the time! Mother's Day would be a major promotional opportunity to bring together families around stories for Mother Earth and the changing times we're living in.

The benefits of the "Pacha’s Pajamas" branded eBook:

  • Capture the attention of parents and youth
  • Be connected with an amazing story that is going to be huge
  • Get readers involved with campaigns
  • Drive traffic to website, campaigns, and products
  • Give constituency a free gift.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $3000 to support the following:


  • eBook design and layout: $1,000
  • eBook cover: $1,000 
  • School performances: $500
  • Launch party production: $500


Your support is critical to complete the eBook and produce a successful launch party! 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please contribute what you can and spread the word!

story:
The Goal

Help my music business offset 23.6 tons of C02 emissions over the next five years by joining me in an effort to raise enough funds to purchase a Toyota Prius!

The Problem

Hey Folks! My name is Tom Burgess, and I play my acoustic guitar all over New England, playing roughly 170 shows every year.  While it is a great time travelling through New England in my 1995 Ford F-150, I have become extremely concerned with the carbon emissions that result from my travels. When carbon is emitted into the atmosphere, it captures the suns energy, and turns it into heat via the greenhouse effect. This contributes to global warming, coastal inundation, severe weather shocks, droughts, and water shortages.  In 2012, I drove 12,137 miles from my southern Rhode Island home to shows in New England and New York.

12,317 miles driven in my Ford F-150 results in 7.37 tons of carbon emissions every year! That is entirely unacceptable! This is the problem. My Ford can last me another 5 years, and after 5 years at my current pace, my carbon footprint would be 36.85 tons of CO2 emitted into the atmosphere from my vehicle alone.

The Solution

12,317 miles driven in a Toyota Prius would result in a reduction of 23.6 tons of carbon emissions versus my Ford F-150 over the next five years. That number is huge! Please help me reduce my carbon footprint!

You may ask why I own a Ford F-150 if I care so much about the environment. The reason is because it was a reliable low cost vehicle, and has the famed “straight six” engine, which would last me forever. That’s the problem though -- it will last forever.

If you help me raise enough funds, I will buy the best Prius that I can with the money that you donate.

Other Action Steps for my Business to Become More Sustainable

I have identified that my two greatest negative impacts to society are through my carbon emissions, and from the waste created from my profession. Asides from the carbon emissions that occur when I travel to a show, I go through 10 or 15 harmonicas each year, 12 sets of strings, and 12 batteries. My sustainability plan outside of this Prius fundraiser is to:

-          recycling of harmonicas

-          invest in rechargeable batteries

-          recycling of strings

-          Taylor guitar used at shows is made 100% sustainably

-          the QSC speakers I use are manufactured to be as sustainable as possible

-          playing as many charity and benefit shows as I can

-          employing other musicians in the community

-          reduce my demand for gasoline, leaving more for others at a lower cost

-          create an online forum that would serve as a guide to help other  low-income musicians find creative ways to incorporate sustainable practices in their businesses

 

Please help me fight climate change!

 

Stats:

12137 miles driven @14mpg = 867 gallons ~ 7.37 tons of C02 emissions

12137 miles driven @50 mpg = 242 gallons ~ 2.65 tons of C02 emissions

 

*Miles are the exact amount from gigs in 2012, and calculations for miles driven each year are based off of 2012's numbers

*Travel in 2012 was to a combined 29 venues in Rhode Island, Massachusetts, Connecticut, and New York

*Miles driven will increase in 2013 because of a summer gig every week in Lake George, NY

story:
Table of Contents

1. Summary
2. So Far...
3. About Us
4. Phase 2
5. Phase 3
6. Phase 4
7: Budgets
8. The Impact of Your Support
9. Other Ways You Can Help
10: Perks!

Summary

     In June of this year, President Obama laid out his "Climate Action Plan" to "reduce carbon emissions, prepare the U.S. for the impacts of climate change, and lead international efforts to address global climate change." These proposals are an improvement on previous plans put forward by the Administration, but they still don't reduce our emissions to the levels that scientists and policy experts say industrialized countries need to reach in order to avoid the worst impacts of a dramatically warmer planet.

So Far...

 Over the summer, we conducted extensive research to come  up with an alternative set of policies that the President and  Congress can embrace in order to get us within this safe range  of emissions reductions by 2020 and lead us to carbon  neutrality by 2050. We called this, Phase 1, which is compiled  in a report available for download on our website. Now, we are  trying to take our message to a broader audience in order to
 elevate  the  national dialogue around climate change and show people that there are common-sense policy solutions that can help us overcome our energy challenges and usher in a new era of American prosperity and energy independence. We've gotten considerable media attention already, including an op-ed about us written in U.S. News & World Report.

About Us:

     Concerned by the fact that our country—one of the world's leading economies and political superpowers—had nothing that remotely resembled a national energy strategy despite constant concerns over energy security, a seemingly unquenchable demand for energy, an unfolding climate crisis, and years of political posturing, Evan, Matt, and Michael set out from Wesleyan Univeristy in May to create a comprehensive energy plan that the Obama Administration could embrace.

Evan Weber                  Matt Lichtash               Dr. Michael Dorsey

     Matt and Evan were classmates and roommates at Wesleyan, and both hold degrees in Economics and Environmental Studies. Dr. Michael K. Dorsey is a professor at Dartmouth College and was a visiting professor at Wesleyan's College of the Environment. Evan and Michael both served as 2012-2013 fellows in the College of the Environment Think Tank on Global Health and Environmental Justice, where the idea for The Plan was born.

Phase 2:

     The Plan has undergone extensive review by academics, politicians, scientists, advocates, and industry experts, and is now ready for the public. The next step in this process is to make sure that a lot of people see it, and that the right people see it. To do this we will be promoting these climate solutions through print, radio, television, social media, constituent outreach, and engagement with politicians and government officials. However, for us to be successful in this, we have to be able to really devote ourselves to it, and that's where you come in. Your support will allow us to sustain our efforts in moving real solutions forward and give us the extra push we need to gain the attention of the media and politicians to show them that we are all ready for bold action.

Phase 3:

     In order to really showcase our  ideas and further build support for  The Plan, we want to host a  conference. As of now, our goal is to  host it in April around Earth Day at  the place where the idea for The  Plan was born: Wesleyan University.  We have already begun the initial  planning stages for the conference  such as identifying and being in talks  with potential partners (and/or  funding sources) in the University, community, and other circles, but to successfully pull off the high profile event we have planned, it will require a lot more work and resources. We believe this conference can be highly successful at bringing in the best and brightest to convene around climate action and catalyze youth, students, and others forward in demanding solutions. (There is precedent for this, as well.)

Phase 4:

During Phases 2 & 3, we will also be working on curating experts to expand The Plan into a more comprehensive document that details the impacts and effects of our proposed policies.This will help to bolster the feasibility of The Plan and show Americans what the specifics of real climate solutions would look like. The work for this will start as soon as we have the available funds, but we plan on pulling it all together after Phase 3. 

Budgets

Budget for Phase 2:

  • Salaries:

    • Evan: $13.67/hr (DC living wage)*40 hrs/week*4.29 weeks/month*2 months= $4,692

    • Matt: $13.67/hr (DC living wage)*30 hrs/week*4.29 weeks/month*2 months= $3,519

    • Michael: $400 stipend

Sub-total=$8,611

  • Travel expenses:

    • Evan & Matt=$400

    • Michael: $400

Sub-total=$800

  • Office space:

    • $400/month*2 months=$800

Sub-total=$800

  • Other overhead (including web services, supplies, etc.):

    • $120/month*2 months=$240

Sub-total=$240  

  • Processing fees:

    • ($8,611+$800+$800+240)*4% Indiegogo fees=$418

    • ($8,611+$800+$800+240)*3% payment processing fees=$314

Sub-total=$732

Total= $11,183

If we don't reach our Phase 2 goal:

     We have opted for "flexible funding." What this means is that if we don't reach our goal, we still get to keep the funds we raise. Indiegogo recommends this funding option for campaigns that can still have an impact even if they are not fully funded. For us, this makes a lot of sense. The more money we raise, the longer we will be able to sustain our outreach. Although we received funding for the research stage of the project from the Wesleyan University Green Fund, we have been operating out-of-pocket for the month of September, and will continue to do so for the extent of this campaign. We want to keep pushing for climate solutions as much as we can for as long as we can. So even if we don't make our goal for Phase 2, your support will still help us to spread the word about The Plan and will hopefully give us the cushion we need to find other funding sources.

Stretch Goals—Phases 3&4:

Budget for Phase 3:

  • Coordinator salaries: $2,350/month*4 months*2 coordinators= $18,800
  • Travel, lodging, & incidentals for 10 speakers: $10,000
  • Speaker Stipend: $500 per speaker*10 speakers=$5,000
  • Media Services: $2,500
  • Intern stipends: $1000
  • Receptions: $1,000
  • Materials: $700
Total: $40,000

Budget for Phase 4:

  • Author stipends: $10,000
  • Editorial assistance: $5,000
  • Publishing fees: $2,000
  • Promotional: $3,000
Total: $20,000

The Impact of Your Support

     Unless we act aggressively and promptly, the world as we know it will be fundamentally changed. This isn't some far off threat anymore. We have already begun to see the economic losses that extreme weather and a changing normal can inflict; the unmeasurable losses of human lives, communities, and cultures are even more daunting. If the world acts now, we can stave off the worst of these damages and create a better world for our children, but in order for this to happen, the U.S. needs to lead. 

     By contributing, you become a part of a movement demanding a safe future—a movement grounded in science and backed by sensible policy solutions. We have to push the conversation forward because physics does not understand the language of political compromise. 

     That being said, we understand that the politics are challenging and we don't know if we can break the climate and energy gridlock that currently exists. What we do know, however, is that we definitely won't be able to see the solutions we need if we don't demand them. This is how you change the politics—one voice at a time.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!

  • Follow us on Twitter, Like our page on Facebook, sign up for our mailing list, and tell your friends to do the same
  • Share our updates on social media and tell your friends that there are real solutions to our climate and energy problems that the President and Congress should embrace.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our campaign and get the chance to win a custom music video performed by Evan and Matt! This will also help us to gain more prominence on the Indiegogo website!

Dear _____,

I’d like to share with you a campaign dedicated to solving an issue all-too-often overlooked in politics. Two recent graduates from Wesleyan University, along with one of their professors, started a group called "U.S. Climate Plan" and came up with a national energy strategy that will slash our trade deficit and reliance on foreign sources of energy, reduce our vulnerability to oil price shocks, and put our greenhouse gas emissions on a trajectory that can actually ensure that we avoid the great threat of a fundamentally altered climate. They just came out with a new report called The Plan: How the U.S. Can Help Stabilize the Climate and Create a Clean Energy Future, a comprehensive document that has been extensively researched and reviewed by some of the top policy experts, academics, and scientists. They have since started a fundraising campaign in order to further engage with media and elevate the national dialogue around bold climate and energy solutions.

That’s where you come in: they need additional funds in order to fully dedicate themselves to Phase 2, the outreach and promotional phase of The Plan. By November 17th, U.S. Climate Plan must raise $11,183. They have made great progress, but they need to keep the momentum going. You can check out http://igg.me/at/theplan to get a better idea of what their campaign is all about and contribute. Plus, you can get some awesome perks by donating enough: stickers, personalized music videos, and even a bound and signed copy of The Plan.If you are unable to financially support them, sharing this email with 5 of your closest friends and family will help to get the word out, as will liking The Plan on Facebook, following them on Twitter, and signing up for their mailing list. Thanks so much!

  • Referral perk: Custom thank-you music video!
story_txt:
Table of Contents

1. Summary2. So Far... 3. About Us4. Phase 25. Phase 36. Phase 47: Budgets8. The Impact of Your Support9. Other Ways You Can Help10: Perks!

Summary
     In June of this year, President Obama laid out his "Climate Action Plan" to "reduce carbon emissions, prepare the U.S. for the impacts of climate change, and lead international efforts to address global climate change." These proposals are an improvement on previous plans put forward by the Administration, but they still don't reduce our emissions to the levels that scientists and policy experts say industrialized countries need to reach in order to avoid the worst impacts of a dramatically warmer planet.

So Far...

 Over the summer, we conducted extensive research to come  up with an alternative set of policies that the President and  Congress can embrace in order to get us within this safe range  of emissions reductions by 2020 and lead us to carbon  neutrality by 2050. We called this, Phase 1, which is compiled  in a report available for download on our website. Now, we are  trying to take our message to a broader audience in order to  elevate  the  national dialogue around climate change and show people that there are common-sense policy solutions that can help us overcome our energy challenges and usher in a new era of American prosperity and energy independence. We've gotten considerable media attention already, including an op-ed about us written in U.S. News & World Report.

About Us:
     Concerned by the fact that our country—one of the world's leading economies and political superpowers—had nothing that remotely resembled a national energy strategy despite constant concerns over energy security, a seemingly unquenchable demand for energy, an unfolding climate crisis, and years of political posturing, Evan, Matt, and Michael set out from Wesleyan Univeristy in May to create a comprehensive energy plan that the Obama Administration could embrace.


Evan Weber                  Matt Lichtash               Dr. Michael Dorsey

     Matt and Evan were classmates and roommates at Wesleyan, and both hold degrees in Economics and Environmental Studies. Dr. Michael K. Dorsey is a professor at Dartmouth College and was a visiting professor at Wesleyan's College of the Environment. Evan and Michael both served as 2012-2013 fellows in the College of the Environment Think Tank on Global Health and Environmental Justice, where the idea for The Plan was born.


Phase 2:





     The Plan has undergone extensive review by academics, politicians, scientists, advocates, and industry experts, and is now ready for the public. The next step in this process is to make sure that a lot of people see it, and that the right people see it. To do this we will be promoting these climate solutions through print, radio, television, social media, constituent outreach, and engagement with politicians and government officials. However, for us to be successful in this, we have to be able to really devote ourselves to it, and that's where you come in. Your support will allow us to sustain our efforts in moving real solutions forward and give us the extra push we need to gain the attention of the media and politicians to show them that we are all ready for bold action.

Phase 3:

     In order to really showcase our  ideas and further build support for  The Plan, we want to host a  conference. As of now, our goal is to  host it in April around Earth Day at  the place where the idea for The  Plan was born: Wesleyan University.  We have already begun the initial  planning stages for the conference  such as identifying and being in talks  with potential partners (and/or  funding sources) in the University, community, and other circles, but to successfully pull off the high profile event we have planned, it will require a lot more work and resources. We believe this conference can be highly successful at bringing in the best and brightest to convene around climate action and catalyze youth, students, and others forward in demanding solutions. (There is precedent for this, as well.)
Phase 4:During Phases 2 & 3, we will also be working on curating experts to expand The Plan into a more comprehensive document that details the impacts and effects of our proposed policies.This will help to bolster the feasibility of The Plan and show Americans what the specifics of real climate solutions would look like. The work for this will start as soon as we have the available funds, but we plan on pulling it all together after Phase 3.

story:
It's very simple, I just need a truck :)

How it works:

Instead of the garbage can, restaurants in town place their food scraps in reusable, sealed buckets and sit them out back for me. I collect them weekly and compost them. Any re-growable scraps are planted, and the resulting abundance is shared with my community. At the moment, I am collecting from Nourish, Viva Raw, and personal kitchens all across town, and I don't want any of it to go to waste while I'm without transportation.

 

Thank you for your continued support on this weird journey of mine.

story:
This is a collaborative effort of two life long friends,  one living in India and the other in the USA to do something to impact the lives of people in India.  We set out in 2013 to start a Grid Connected Solar Plant in India under a scheme launched by the Government in the State of Punjab in India.  After a long tedious process we have been successfully awarded a 4 MW plant connected to the Grid located in the Village of Bhadson in the state of Punjab.  This approval comes with a 25 year Power Purchase Agreement to sell every watt of electricity produced to the Local distribution Company.    The cost of the project is approximately $6.15 Million.  Both me and my friend have contributed $750,000.00 each for a total of $1,500,000.00 in Partners equity and are trying to raise the balance of approximately $4.65 Million through Financial institutions.  Here we are 1 year later and only 6 months from our deadline still trying to get the final approvals from the banks.  So here we are trying to go the crowdfuinding route to save this project and do the right thing:

Key Investment Features:

  • Land is Purchased and located in the Village of Bhadson, District of Patiala in Punjab.
  • PPA is executed with Punjab State Power Corporation Limited (PSPCL)
  • EPC Contractor has been selected.  The selected Company is Larsen and Tubro (L&T) Infrastructure which is the largest Construction Company in India
  • L&T is also responsible for the Operations and management of the Plant for a pre set fee
  • (L&T) also guarantees a 78% energy generation
  • Equity is already Invested and verifiable

So here are the projections (remember all the generation is pre sold to the government); 5 Years are shown here.....

Less Losses 1278000 watts
Net Energy Injected into Grid 7727000 Watts
