story:
Creating a New Template for the Future

We are creating a base of operations to accelerate the sustainability movement in our local area and worldwide. We would like to create a model of the homestead of the future, another location to add to the swarm of such projects emerging across the globe. We will produce local food, power, and free educational services and information. We will create a small intentional community of such homesteads, following principles of nonviolent communication and models of communal living set by living Native American societies.

We are mobilizing people in the community, creating local library "town hall" style meetings with delicious organic cooking. At least four more are scheduled before this campaign is over.  I am working with local action groups and attending local meetings in the community for climate action, local food, and environmental cleanup. Several local businesses, organizations and educational institutions have pledged to come talk and contribute their knowledge to the growing pool. If nothing else, we will have at the end of this a thriving network of people committed to making these changes a reality.

Combining the power of local grassroots mobilization, the driving will of the human race to thrive, technology and the power of the crowds, I'm confident this will be a real place. The technology is there and therefore its adoption is inevitable, it's just a matter of time. We can make that waiting time much shorter or virtually elimate it entirely.



Forgive lack of time and experience with this video until I can get a better one up!

*Update 9/24 - EarthStar Foundation is now registered as a nonprofit organization in WA State! This is too late to affect the "verified nonprofit" public status of this campaign, but please contact us so we can get you the info to make your contribution tax deductible!

The Plan

  • Purchase outright (no mortgage) a piece of on-grid property on the North Olympic Peninsula. Exact location to be determined but we want a site on a creek or river so we can demonstrate principles of water treatment and conservation as well as habitat preservation. We have scouted out a number of sites but can't post any yet.
  • Farm the sun and the wind. Immediately install renewable energy technology to start producing power for income right away. 40% or more of our budget is earmarked for vertical axis wind turbines and grid-tie solar. Reduce power consumption using efficient devices and alternative means, treat energy sold to power company as a product we are farming. We may eventually also buy or lease empty plots in other parts of the peninsula where there is more sun and expand the smart grid in our area. More..
  • Set up no-till permaculture gardens in open grassy spaces. Provide spaces for aquaculture and expand riparian habitat. We will be working with local fish biologists to determine optimal water flow for placement of our buildings and plots. More..
  • Develop systems of water management that reduce toxins, radiation and heavy metals even from rainwater. We're working closely with local fish biologists to determine optimum land use for healthy runoff. We're designing technologies that make use of the restorative powers of nature to create homesteads that help clean the environment. More..
  • Expand regreening and reforesting activities in our area and worldwide. There can't be enough life seeded! Life creates conditions which are condusive to life. Trees also grow and literally eat carbon out of the air... for free. Two of our perks allow you to name a tree or shrub that we plant after you.
  • Feed and teach the people. Provide quality local food to markets, cafeterias and restaurants, much of it out of season due to cleanly-heated green domes, along with recipes and local knowledge for cultivation and preparation. Install green domes for GMO-safe cultivation of organic heirloom seeds. More..
  • Install 20' yurts, then build natural cottages using cob. Natural building projects will involve the whole community and we're planning to experiment with a number of methods, including earthships and geodesic domes. More..
  • Convert 2 vehicles to electric, a toyota pickup and a minivan. Install solar on vehicle roof racks to extend battery longevity. More..
  • Meet our basic needs and produce more than enough. Surplus will go into expanding the community as well as supporting similar projects everywhere.
  • Create a community with 2-3 families to start with. We will incorporate nonviolent concepts with direct inspiration from Native American societies existing today in the Amazon. More...
  • Create a learning facility and home school co-op for minds of all ages to practice and create this technology. Methods will focus on constant immersion in nature and creativity. Our curriculum is being designed in part by an experienced outdoor educator and lifelong environmental learning advocate. More...

Our Goals

  • Create and promote real sustainable techniques and put them within the grasp of anyone.
  • Cultivate a culture of respect and love for the Earth, naturally attracting sustainable actions.
  • Help to free human beings from endless acquisition of material or work to fill a financial void.
  • Increase meaningful quality of life by bringing people closer to nature and the means of their living.
  • Learn from nature itself more and more means to adapt our technology to its tried-and-true methods.
  • Work with local organizations and schools to teach the next generation.
  • Create real living community of families living in proximity, sharing meals and a real hearth-and-home culture.
  • Re-establish real family values that involve the next generation with home and work life.
  • Create a virtual nexus of information to spread through social media, applications, and other web presence.
  • Provide a complete quality organic local diet to people in the area.
  • Provide ample power to all on-site residents and extra power to community.
  • Cultivate an organic heirloom seed reserve in GMO-safe green domes.
  • Provide easy open-source instruction manuals and designs to create sustainable technologies everywhere.
  • Funnel profits garnered from excess power production and local food markets into grants and related projects.

$180,000 is a lot of money. Why do you need that much?

We have priced the goal of this campaign to match the mean price of a normal 3-bedroom home in this area that a family might move into. We are trying to show that the same financial investment could go to creating an all-encompassing renewable foundation with a capacity for endless growth. By crowdfunding the entire effort we hope to mobilize immediately and soon create enough abundance that we can grant funding to similar projects and invest in community mutual funds to create green infrastructure and businesses. By creating a local example that renewable enterprise can be financially profitable we hope to encourage banks to lend out capital to sustainable projects. If the grant system and mutual funds grow in popularity and strength it could eventually create natural competition for traditional mortgages and force banks to lower interest rates, which would help the middle class and slow the rapid upward redistribution of the nation's wealth. In other words, by helping fund this amount now you can make it easier for these kinds of projects to get funded in the future.


Why this? Why Now?

  • Global warming isn't cooling down and practically every expert with an opinion on the matter thinks we haven't yet seen the full wrath that a modified climate can unleash. The plain truth is that clean energy technologies need to be adopted en masse yesterday.
  • The global food system is making the planet and all its people sick. Local food systems providing healthy products to communities and protecting ecosystems rapidly need to become mainstream before they are snuffed out by gigantic agribusiness seeking to control all food.
  • Plastic, mostly used for packaging that will only touch human hands for about 10 seconds, is choking the life out of sea animals and saturating the food chain of the planet. There are grassroots organizations finding creative ways to something about this, with great success, but we need to create a local food and technology culture that reduces the demand for this waseful material to even exist.
  • The moment is now, the need has never been higher, and the iron is hot. There is a massive undercurrent sweeping all generations and sustainability is the buzzword for a generation that is rapidly mobilizing. Green projects are making newspaper headlines all over the world. Any kind of investment into this sort of a project right now is a good idea in the short and long run.
  • The principle of land ownership by people is at risk. With recent redistribution of wealth upward and massive acquisition of property by banks which are in a lending ice age, the costs and challenges of owning land are becoming too great for many to handle. Private land ownership is essential for causes like forest and water management and for projects like this to exist. Creative solutions are needed for creating funding mechanisms for responsible land stewardship which will be unlikely if land is in the hands of corporations.
  • Thousands of species are going extinct and habitats are disappearing, many in peoples' own backyards, without their even knowing. Educating the next generation on the importance of healthy, diverse ecosystems is the greatest hope to protecting them and the fragile balance they maintain.
  • There is no greater cause, and no more exciting opportunity, than designing our civilization to last.

If We Don't Get All Our Funding

This won't stop us. There are lots of people willing to allow the use of their land through donation, lease, or lease-to-own. If we are unable to get land of our own right away we already have connections to groups and farms that are doing this work.  We would then re-configure the campaign and continuing to expand the social networks before running it again.

Much of the renewable energy tech and buildings will be mobile meaning it won't be a permanent fixture and we can move it easily to another property when we get it. As much money as possible will be going into solar and other sustainable energy. We will still be able, just with what I put in myself over the course of the campaign, to purchase a yurt. I already have enough staple and fresh produce seeds to start a small farm as it is, so that aspect is covered. My apartment lease is up October 31st so one way or another, this is the lifestyle we will be moving into this November.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you agree with our ideas and think our project is interesting, but for some reason you can't donate money, please Share this Campaign on your Facebook and Twitter accounts so we can spread this as far as possible! Please also check out our website as well as Making Sustainability Real on Facebook and @EarthStarRising on Twitter - we're already sharing sustainable practices now! The power of a million voices committed to a single cause can create great change. Thanks again for reading! Help us make sustainability mainstream for humanity in this decade!
story_txt:
Creating a New Template for the Future

We are creating a base of operations to accelerate the sustainability movement in our local area and worldwide. We would like to create a model of the homestead of the future, another location to add to the swarm of such projects emerging across the globe. We will produce local food, power, and free educational services and information. We will create a small intentional community of such homesteads, following principles of nonviolent communication and models of communal living set by living Native American societies.

We are mobilizing people  in the community, creating local library "town hall" style meetings with delicious organic cooking. At least four more are scheduled before this campaign is over.  I am working with local action groups and attending local meetings in the community for climate action, local food, and environmental cleanup. Several local businesses, organizations and educational institutions have pledged to come talk and contribute their knowledge to the growing pool. If nothing else, we will have at the end of this a thriving network of people committed to making these changes a reality.
Combining the power of local grassroots mobilization, the driving will of the human race to thrive, technology and the power of the crowds, I'm confident this will be a real place. The technology is there and therefore its adoption is inevitable, it's just a matter of time. We can make that waiting time much shorter or virtually elimate it entirely.

Forgive lack of time and experience with this video until I can get a better one up!
*Update 9/24 - EarthStar Foundation is now registered as a nonprofit organization in WA State! This is too late to affect the "verified nonprofit" public status of this campaign, but please contact us so we can get you the info to make your contribution tax deductible!The Plan

Purchase outright (no mortgage) a piece of on-grid property on the North Olympic Peninsula. Exact location to be determined but we want a site on a creek or river so we can demonstrate principles of water treatment and conservation as well as habitat preservation. We have scouted out a number of sites but can't post any yet.
Farm the sun and the wind. Immediately install renewable energy technology to start producing power for income right away. 40% or more of our budget is earmarked for vertical axis wind turbines  and grid-tie solar.  Reduce power consumption using efficient devices and alternative means, treat energy sold to power company as a product we are farming. We may eventually also buy or lease empty plots in other parts of the peninsula where there is more sun and expand the smart grid in our area. More..
Set up no-till permaculture gardens in open grassy spaces. Provide spaces for aquaculture and expand riparian habitat. We will be working with local fish biologists to determine optimal water flow for placement of our buildings and plots. More..
Develop systems of water management that reduce toxins, radiation and heavy metals even from rainwater. We're working closely with local fish biologists to determine optimum land use for healthy runoff. We're designing technologies that make use of the restorative powers of nature to create homesteads that help clean the environment.  More..

Expand regreening and reforesting activities in our area and worldwide. There can't be enough life seeded! Life creates conditions which are condusive to life. Trees also grow and literally eat carbon out of the air... for free. Two of our perks allow you to name a tree or shrub that we plant after you.

Feed and teach the people. Provide quality local food to markets, cafeterias and restaurants, much of it out of season due to cleanly-heated green domes, along with recipes and local knowledge for cultivation and preparation. Install green domes for GMO-safe cultivation of organic heirloom seeds. More..

Install 20' yurts, then build natural cottages using cob. Natural building projects will involve the whole community and we're planning to experiment with a number of methods, including earthships and geodesic domes. More..
Convert 2 vehicles to electric, a toyota pickup and a minivan. Install solar on vehicle roof racks to extend battery longevity. More..
Meet our basic needs and produce more than enough. Surplus will go into expanding the community as well as supporting similar projects everywhere.
Create a community with 2-3 families to start with. We will incorporate nonviolent concepts with direct inspiration from Native American societies existing today in the Amazon. More...
 Create a learning facility and home school co-op  for minds of all ages to practice and create this technology. Methods will focus on constant immersion in nature and creativity. Our curriculum is being designed in part by an experienced outdoor educator and lifelong environmental learning advocate. More...

Our Goals

Create and promote real sustainable techniques and put them within the grasp of anyone.
Cultivate a culture of respect and love for the Earth, naturally attracting sustainable actions.
Help to free human beings from endless acquisition of material or work to fill a financial void.
Increase meaningful quality of life by bringing people closer to nature and the means of their living.

Learn from nature itself more and more means to adapt our technology to its tried-and-true methods.
Work with local organizations and schools to teach the next generation.
Create real living community of families living in proximity, sharing meals and a real hearth-and-home culture.

Re-establish real family values that involve the next generation with  home and work life.
Create a virtual nexus of information to spread through social media, applications, and other web presence.
Provide a complete quality organic local diet to people in the area.
Provide ample power to all on-site residents and extra power to community.
Cultivate an organic heirloom seed reserve in GMO-safe green domes.
Provide easy open-source instruction manuals and designs to create sustainable technologies everywhere.
Funnel profits garnered from excess power production and local food markets into grants and related projects.


$180,000 is a lot of money. Why do you need that much?
We have priced the goal of this campaign to match the mean price of a normal 3-bedroom home in this area that a family might move into. We are trying to show that the same financial investment could go to creating an all-encompassing renewable foundation with a capacity for endless growth.  By crowdfunding the entire effort we hope to mobilize immediately and soon create enough abundance that we can grant funding to similar projects and invest in community mutual funds to create green infrastructure and businesses.  By creating a local example that renewable enterprise can be financially profitable we hope to encourage banks to lend out capital to sustainable projects. If the grant system and mutual funds grow in popularity and strength it could eventually create natural competition for traditional mortgages and force banks to lower interest rates, which would help the middle class and slow the rapid upward redistribution of the nation's wealth. In other words, by helping fund this amount now you can make it easier for these kinds of projects to get funded in the future.
Why this? Why Now?


Global warming isn't cooling down and practically every expert with an opinion on the matter thinks we haven't yet seen the full wrath that a modified climate can unleash. The plain truth  is that clean energy technologies need to be adopted en masse yesterday.


The global food system is making the planet and all its people sick. Local food systems providing healthy products to communities and protecting ecosystems rapidly need to become mainstream before they are snuffed out by gigantic agribusiness seeking to control all food.

Plastic, mostly used for packaging that will only touch human hands for about 10 seconds, is choking the life out of sea animals and saturating the food chain of the planet. There are grassroots organizations finding creative ways to something about this, with great success, but we need to create a local food and technology culture that reduces the demand for this waseful material to even exist.

The moment is now, the need has never been higher, and the iron is hot. There is a massive undercurrent sweeping all generations and sustainability is the buzzword for a generation that is rapidly mobilizing. Green projects are making newspaper headlines all over the world. Any kind of investment into this sort of a project right now is a good idea in the short and long run.

The principle of land ownership by people  is at risk. With recent redistribution of wealth upward and massive acquisition of property by banks which are in a lending ice age, the costs and challenges of owning land are becoming too great for many to handle. Private land ownership is essential for causes like forest and water management and for projects like this to exist. Creative solutions are needed for creating funding mechanisms for responsible land stewardship which will be unlikely if land is in the hands of corporations.

Thousands of species are going extinct and habitats are disappearing, many in peoples' own backyards, without their even knowing. Educating the next generation on the importance of healthy, diverse ecosystems is the greatest hope to protecting them and the fragile balance they maintain.

There is no greater cause, and no more exciting opportunity, than designing our civilization to last.

If We Don't Get All Our Funding
This won't stop us. There are lots of people willing to allow the use of their land through donation, lease, or lease-to-own. If we are unable to get land of our own right away we already have connections to groups and farms that are doing this work.  We would then re-configure the campaign and continuing to expand the social networks before running it again. 
Much of the renewable energy tech and buildings will be mobile meaning it won't be a permanent fixture and we can move it easily to another property when we get it. As much money as possible will be going into solar and other sustainable energy. We will still be able, just with what I put in myself over the course of the campaign, to purchase a yurt. I already have enough staple and fresh produce seeds to start a small farm as it is, so that aspect is covered. My apartment lease is up October 31st so one way or another, this is the lifestyle we will be moving into this November.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you agree with our ideas and think our project is interesting, but for some reason you can't donate money, please Share this Campaign on your Facebook and Twitter accounts so we can spread this as far as possible! Please also check out our website as well as Making Sustainability Real on Facebook and @EarthStarRising on Twitter - we're already sharing sustainable practices now! The power of a million voices committed to a single cause can create great change. Thanks again for reading! Help us make sustainability mainstream for humanity in this decade!

story:
The Second Stage of the Project

As you know I managed to reach 1025 Euros in one month thanks to all your helps! And again, as you remember, I had to split up the total amount as we need 10.000 TL to be able to create a memory forest. That means 2000 trees. My local friends also donated to my special account that I created for this event. We now have almost the half of what we need. And that is GREAT. 

Now, we are in the second and in the final step. If you think any of your friends might help, please feel free to share! You can also donate for a friend's, lover's, family member's bday as a gift. In the end of the project, I can receive a special 'thank you' document from TEMA (the turkish foundation for combating erosion reforestation and the protection of natural habitats). 

Remember that this project is not only for my friend but also for a better environment. Also, this will be a surprise for his family. They don't know anything about the project.

1 tree is 5 TL. This should be 1.6 Euro. Less than a coffee expense! You don't need to have a paypal account if you wanna help. 

And if you have any idea, recommendation, advice, questionmark in mind, please feel free to reach me from gulsaheroll@gmail.com.

Thanking everyone who has given me their best support in the first campaign, who trusted me and believed in me. 

Payment documents and TEMA certification will be sent to everyone who donated for this cause. 

And here is the link of our first campaign page: http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/help-me-create-a-forest-for-the-better

story:
Short Summary

1 tree feeds a family of 4 for 75 plus years.

100 trees feeds a small community of 400 for 75 plus years.

  • Quincy Burgess is COO of Bonsai, a company committed to solving food insecurity problems sustainably. With a Masters degrees in Plant Science from Hebrew University, he is well versed with the need for a long term solution to food secuity in East Africa.
  • This campaign is ground breaking. For the first time, is there a staple food which can be grown from a tree.
  • With this innovative insight, we can feed millions through creating storable products from the fruits, thereby mitigating the effects of sporadic climatic changes.

What We Need & What You Get

  • $5,000 helps plant 300 trees and feeds 1,200 people for 75 plus years.
  • You have the option to have your trees named with you as the donor.
  • If we do not reach our entire goal, we will bank the funds until all the funds come In.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • This is the first campaign in an effort to plant 100,000 trees. In planting this amount of trees in 2 years, we will be on our way to feeding 10 million in 10 years.
  • We have already began to implement food sustainable solutions through our two greenhouse projects at a school and orphanage.
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

Thankfully, this is not the first time we have implemented such a project, so we have encountered many of the risks and challenges.

  • We project based on past projects that 10% of our trees will die, hence our estimates of 300 trees and not 333.
  • We have also partnered with local implementing partners in our growing areas, to ensure that communities take ownership of the trees and not become dependent on handouts.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Money is not the only form of help, please let others know through visiting our websites wwww.globalbreadfruit.com learning more about this life changing crop and sharing with others!

That's it!

story:
THE TIERRA BOMBA BOTTLE PROJECT



The Goal

We will build 12 eco sustainable community centers in South & Central American countries of need,that will help improve the lives of developing communities of need. These community centers will be built from old plastic bottles & recycled waste materials,while being transformed into works of art.  The Tierra Bomba Bottle Center will be housed with computers,books, clean water & community waste solutions,while aiding as an added art & culture reinforcement to community preservation. We have the designs, the prototypes, and the motivation.  

Our added goals include reaching at-risk youth in Colombia through a variety of programs aimed to serve the whole person & family. These include education,health,technology,job training,and cultural development. We plan to build facilities to address the needs of these communities.  Now we need your help as we help the children build an eco-sustainable community center in Colombia. 

 

The Background

"The Tierra Bomba Bottle project": 

Tierrabomba is an island located 1 mile south of Cartagena de Indias, Colombia. The island has approximately 10.000 inhabitants, distributed in 4 small villages: Caño del Oro, Punta Arena, Bocachica y Tierrabomba.

Standing alone in, just 10 minutes by boat from Colombia’s hottest touristic destination,world class conventions and summits. People of Tierrabomba are descendents of slaves that claimed the island as home. The island has beautiful beaches and great ocean life around it, making it a place with great potential for touristic activities and attractions.  Even though the island has great potential, the lack of waste logistics,clean water,monetary sources,opportunities and quality education, leaves dreams of improvement of a quality life in a distant reality. 

The ocean that separates the island from Cartagena seems wider when it comes to social and economic assistance. Tierrabomba has critical health issues created by the lack of potable water, dysfunctional or absence of septic tanks, no sewerage and poor medical assistance. “Tierrabomberos” (people of Tierrabomba) have two main occupations; they are either fisherman or work in tourism. Both occupations are affected by either climate change or seasons, making earning a living an everyday struggle. Tierrabomba’s culture, its heritage is fading away; kids want to learn how to drive a boat or to fish and girls want to learn how to massage or make hairdressing beads, these are the only options they seem to have in a future, leaving no space for dancing, singing and other cultural expressions. This project seeks to create new opportunities in the island through art,education,sustainability and tourism.


What We Need 

Our goal of $100,000 will be used for the following:

  • remaining purchase of the property and production.
  • construction of Tierra Bomba Bottle Center Building
  • building will house the following:
  •   - feeding center for children of the school
  •   - media center with computers,books,educational tools.
  •   - clean water filtration and waste management resources
  •   - multi-purpose room for community meetings, job workshops, and special events
  •   - workshop area for artisans to make jewelry for our Tierra Bomba Bottle program 
      - counseling area for youth and families 

(EXAMPLE #1)

The Impact 

Your contribution will directly benefit the children and families served:

  • Computers and Technology needs

  • At-risk parents will receive training in job skills, money management, sustainability, and more. 
  • Clothing,sneakers,flip flops and hygiene essentials.
  • Community children will have a multi-purpose space to eat meals, study after school, and have an added place to develop their minds and bodies.
  • Provide leadership training to parents, staff, and surrounding community leaders. 
  • Children in crisis will have a place to come and receive counseling, food, and a path towards health. 
  • Tierra Bomba will house its own waste removal/recycling program.
  • Longer life spans for residents 
  • Education 
  • Create Sustainable jobs

  • Clean water filtration resources

  • Waste mangement centers

  • Clothing,books,hygiene items

  • PRIDE

(EXAMPLE #2)

(EXAMPLE #3)


What You Get

We've lined up a series of perks meant to help you share in the spirit and excitement of using technology to help some of the poorest people on earth. We feel a lot of enthusiasm for our project and what it means and we want to help plant that seed in you as well. Check out our descriptions on the right and see what kind of inspiration we can create in your life.


Some of our many perks:



Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • We ask for you to get the word out and make some noise about our Tierra Bomba Bottle Project campaign.

-Thank You :)

story:
Housing your community, family, self is an inherent right. The Sovereign Housing Project aims to provide housing to our First Nations communities without waiting for government funding. We want to alleviate the housing crisis that all reserves are faced with, live in harmony with the land, and to provide food security by starting and maintaining permaculture based endeavours. By doing this on lands that are flagged for Industry we can create precedence in “British Columbia” to say we have NO TREATY and will protect our lands. This will promote culture, spirituality, and healing of our youth and elders and reclaiming our rights and title to the lands.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • get the word out and make some noise about this
  • we need a boat, truck, other items please ask me

story:
PHOG Water's Mission

Hello, and welcome to our campaign!

PHOG utilizes cloud harvesting - an innovative, non-invasive, and energy-free technique - to sustainably source pure water directly from the clouds. As water quickly becomes the most sought-after resource, we seek to use this simple, proven technology to respond creatively to the challenges facing our changing world.

PHOG Water offers a sustainable and ecologically friendly water that runs counter to the dominant trends in the industry. Rather than simply taking resources, we replenish them. Just as PHOG is more than your average water, we want to be more than just your average water company. We're committed to helping start high-impact water access initiatives around the world and want to help spread cloud and fog harvesting technology to every site feasible. We're dedicated to creating clean water communities with people just like you, by sharing our knowledge and resources related to cloud and fog harvesting and inviting people around the world to be a part of the solution.



Keep Climbing

During Princeton University's entrepreneur lab in the summer of 2013,  we installed a successful pilot site on the summit of La Soufriere, a volcano on the Caribbean island of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines. Our pilot installation showed that the site can produce millions of liters of cloud-harvested water a year. We need your help to access it. A $10,000 investment will provide us with the capital needed to set up a viable cloud harvesting system, with 3 nets, piping, collection tanks, and labor. 

With your support, not only are you investing in changing the expectations of the industry and changing lives, but you will receive one or more of the following items:

  • A behind-the-scenes video of PHOG's next Caribbean excursion
  • PHOG's exclusive collapsible, reusable bottle
  • A PHOG Water tee depicting the clouds of La Soufriere
  • Your very own taste of PHOG water, packaged in a campaign exclusive stainless steel bottle
  • A cloud harvesting net dedicated in your name
  • The opportunity to take the journey to St. Vincent and the Grenadines with us

    Water From Thin Air

    Currently, most of the world turns to groundwater sources to meet its drinking water and agricultural needs. However, pumping water from aquifers requires a lot of energy and leads both to groundwater depletion and long-term water level decline. According to the U.S. Geological Survey, issues associated with groundwater depletion include drying up of wells, reduction of surface water levels, lower quality water, and increased pumping costs. Additionally, even when surface sources like lakes and rivers are available, they are susceptible to all types of contamination.

    PHOG Water offers an alternative to groundwater sourcing by turning an untapped resource into a valuable commodity. Cloud harvested water is free from contamination and harvesting has no environmental side effects. What's more, our brand will provide the Caribbean with a local, high-quality product while reducing the reliance on imports.

        Dive In!

        If you are inspired by the PHOG Water mission, spread the word! Want to set up your own site? Follow us on Twitter @PHOGwater, email us directly at phogwater@gmail.com, and share your comments or ideas with us on our website, www.phogwater.com.

        Thank you for checking out PHOG Water!

        Michael, Andrea, and Jeremy
story_txt:
PHOG Water's MissionHello, and welcome to our campaign! PHOG utilizes cloud harvesting - an innovative, non-invasive, and energy-free technique - to sustainably source pure water directly from the clouds. As water quickly becomes the most sought-after resource, we seek to use this simple, proven technology to respond creatively to the challenges facing our changing world.PHOG Water offers a sustainable and ecologically friendly water that runs counter to the dominant trends in the industry. Rather than simply taking resources, we replenish them. Just as PHOG is more than your average water, we want to be more than just your average water company. We're committed to helping start high-impact water access initiatives around the world and want to help spread cloud and fog harvesting technology to every site feasible. We're dedicated to creating clean water communities with people just like you, by sharing our knowledge and resources related to cloud and fog harvesting and inviting people around the world to be a part of the solution.Keep Climbing During Princeton University's entrepreneur lab in the summer of 2013,  we installed a successful pilot site on the summit of La Soufriere, a volcano on the Caribbean island of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines. Our pilot installation showed that the site can produce millions of liters of cloud-harvested water a year. We need your help to access it. A $10,000 investment will provide us with the capital needed to set up a viable cloud harvesting system, with 3 nets, piping, collection tanks, and labor. With your support, not only are you investing in changing the expectations of the industry and changing lives, but you will receive one or more of the following items:
A behind-the-scenes video of PHOG's next Caribbean excursion
PHOG's exclusive collapsible, reusable bottle
A PHOG Water tee depicting the clouds of La Soufriere
Your very own taste of PHOG water, packaged in a campaign exclusive stainless steel bottle
A cloud harvesting net dedicated in your name
The opportunity to take the journey to St. Vincent and the Grenadines with us

story:
Who We Are:

Oceanic Society is a non-profit organization dedicated to ocean conservation since 1969. Turneffe Atoll, Belize is considered the largest and most biologically diverse coral atoll in western hemisphere, and it is home to our field station. Through our research, conservation, tourism, and education programs, we played a key role in supporting the creation of the largest marine reserve in Belize, Turneffe Atoll Marine Reserve, designated by the Belizean Government in 2012.

The conservation and protection of Turneffe Atoll is, and has been, a priority of Oceanic Society for more than 20 years. Since 2001, we have owned and operated the Blackbird Caye Field Station as a center for research, conservation, and education. The field station consists of a 12-acre oceanfront property with cabanas (lodging), classrooms, boats, and facilities that support marine research and monitoring inside Turneffe Atoll Marine Reserve, and it is a base to explore the “living classroom” of the nearby ecosystems. The field station also serves as a cornerstone to our global mission to conserve marine wildlife and habitats by deepening the connections between people and nature.

Our current research and education programs at the field station include:

  • Field testing of drones for marine mammal research
  • The use of side scan sonar to better monitor manatee populations
  • Studying accumulation rates and types of plastic pollution on Blackbird Caye
  • The use of art to interpret the plastic pollution problem to the public
  • Bottlenose dolphin behavior and monitoring research (running for 18 consecutive years) as well as long-term monitoring of other marine megafauna
  • Hosting experiential learning opportunities for U.S. and Belizean students
  • Hosting documentary film students for field based learning of how to communicate science and conservation issues to broader audiences
  • Monitoring invasive lionfish and studying their ecological impact
  • Building on 15 years of ecotourism and voluntourism programs

    What We Need and Why

    Running a remote Caribbean field station and maintaining and powering the boats and other equipment needed to conduct marine research isn't cheap. While we are able to cover most of our daily operating costs through volunteer and traveler fees, additional support is needed to make our research and education programs possible. Your support will allow us to make investments in the continued development of student and research programs, along with the essential equipment, technology, and infrastructure that they rely on.

    The basic infrastructure—lab space, cabanas, classroom, boats, research equipment, and kitchen—are aging (10 to 15 years old), have weathered multiple hurricanes and tropical storms, and are in need of critical repair and upgrading. 

    We are looking for your support to help us continue the above programs this season (summer 2015) by raising funds to ensure that all of our research goals can be met.

    At the same time, we wish to continue to support our student researchers and travel groups as they gain field experience and learn, first-hand, about marine conservation. 
    Your support through this campaign will ensure that our 2015 summer research efforts are completed, and that we will be able to sustain and support the more than 170 researchers, students, artists, and volunteers that will be using our field station over the summer. 
    • $25 will help to ID additional bottlenose dolphins in the Turneffe population
    • $50 will employ one staff person for 4-hrs of lionfish control
    • $100 will provide 200-gallons of drinking water for the station
    • $150 will support 4-hrs of boat based manatee monitoring
    • $200 will provide one full day of dolphin surveys
    • $300 will support one full day of boat based drone monitoring research
    • $500 will support one full day of guided boat based marine field experiences for up to 15 students.

    Your Impact!

    While the costs for Oceanic Society's desired improvements are over $200,000, we are looking to raise a minimum of $10,000 through this campaign.  Your support will help make the following possible:

    • Saving dolphins, manatees, and coral reefs! The continued study, monitoring, and protection of dolphins, manatees, and coral reefs in Turneffe Atoll Marine Reserve, along with investments in new technology to enhance the research.
    • Providing educational field opportunities for Belizeans about the special marine areas they have!  Public outreach and education for Belizean students on marine life and biological research occurring on Turneffe Atoll. 
    • Generating and providing scientific data to resource managers for conservation management policy!  The provision of ecological information to the Belizean government and representatives from the Turneffe Atoll Sustainability Allliance to inform natural resource policy and arm decision-makers with science-based evidence for better long-term conservation measures.
    • Contributing to the continuation of many long-term marine monitoring programs, like our 18-year bottlenose dolphin study. Ultimately these continuous sets of long-term data help the managers of Turneffe Atoll Marine Reserve assure that important and threatened marine habitats (coral reefs, mangroves, seagrass beds) and species are protected. 

    Moreover, by hosting student and volunteer groups we will connect high school and undergraduate students to nature and deliver first-hand knowledge and motivation that exceeds anything they could experience in a classroom setting. These experiences can inspire a lifelong ocean conservation ethic that will benefit marine environments for decades to come.


    Learn more or become a member at www.oceanicsociety.org

story:
Breathe!

We are a group of people who have had the great fortune of growing up in green surroundings. When we were kids, we used to play hide and seek around ancient trees that inspired the stories told by our grandparents. Those stories have helped us to be more conscious about the environment, and also to become activist in ecological conservation.



We are parents now, but we have less and less space in which to tell stories to future generations. We are drowning in an increasingly hostile, desert environment with the threat of the reality of climate change.

That is why we have alredy recovered our first hectare with the help of friends, family, neighbors and experts by repopulating it with native trees and by installing four permanent beehives to pollinate the area. We have also talked to neighbors and farmers door to door, looking for solutions to solve the problems and helping them to abandon the use of pesticides and other poisons in favor of natural, and in many cases cheaper, solutions. 



We put our commitment and free time to continue working, but we need YOUR help.

We want to reforest the world and to show with facts that, with hard work and passion, we can do it.

WE WANT TO BREATHE! HELP US TO BREATHE!


How we do it and what we need

Our goal is to recover lands previously devastated by fire or indiscriminate logging, but it is not easy or cheap to achieve our goal. This is why we need YOUR HELP

We want YOU to be part of our project and become one of the team partners, so simply we would like to explain How We Do It in a simple and schematic way

Work process:

·  We look for areas of land scorched by fire or deforested

·  We analyze the land to nourish it and return it to its ideal state

·  We select the appropriate trees for the area, keeping the "local custom"

·  We work the land, preventing future fires and turning it into a reforested area

·  We develop awareness campaigns among local residents by providing access to sustainable resources

·  We look for the ideal position for our ecological army (beehives) and settle there our bees



And we start again

To develop all these stages in a successful, efficient and sustainable way, we need some resources:

·  We need 12.000€ to recover 1 hectare of land with products and natural fertilizers, and to pay the rent of the necessary equipment to work the land.

·  We need 1.800€ to get 400 trees suitable for the area.

·  We need 2.000€ to get 20 hives and help to extend the pollination process.

·  We need 5.000€ to help local neighbors and farmers to avoid the use of pesticides and poisons that damage both flora and fauna of the environment.

·  We need 1.566€ to pay Indiegogo .



We do not need much, but we NEED YOU. Any help is welcome, from 1 € you can help us to live in a more breathable world in which our future generations can enjoy green environments. You and your contribution are very important for us, so we want you to have the recognition you deserve and be part of our project. This is why you can sponsor one tree or five trees that are going to take your name or the name of the person you want, so you have the opportunity to make an original gift to your loved ones. You can also sponsor a full EcoPath, or beehive.

If we don´t get all the funding, we will adapt the campaign to the funds raised .

Anyway, the next generations could breathe better thanks to you!!


The impact

In the last decade, CO2 emissions have increased 10 gigatons, so CO2 capture is especially important in industrial environments, cities, etc… With just 1 hectare, thousands of CO2 tons will be captured (after analyzing the land and studying the type of tree suitable for the area, we´ll be able to extract specific data), several hectares around it will be pollinated by the oldest soldiers in the world, the bees. And of course, we will fight against those who do not care about their environment and do not give it the importance it deserves by changing their mindset about land and earth.

We are ready for this changes and improvements, are you?

story:
That’s right, give back to your community! We’re Bottles & Wood and we’re all about the circular economy. We believe it starts with the certainty that you can do well by doing good and our Indiegogo campaign is a clear example. We’re raising money to educate our community about the practice of sustainability. Make no mistake, we’re aware of the “what’s in it for me” factor of human nature and that’s why we’re rewarding our donors with the absolute coolest gifts ever for the holidays.

The reward itself represents a conversation opener about sustainability; yea we know they’re super cool rocks glasses! Did you know that in the process of making your reward we kept a few bottles out of the landfill, created a few jobs in our neighborhood, and provided some measure of education to our community? Get it? Don’t just give, give back. It works, we’re Bottles & Wood.


With San Diego landfills reaching capacity, an increasing population, and tourism on the rise, we're facing a serious problem like many other communities in the country. When it comes to glass waste, consumers and businesses are still far from the goal of recycling 100% of this material. Our goal is to repurpose and reuse these materials as close to their source as possible eliminating the entire process of recycling! 

"Upcycling" means we reclaim bottles from local hotels, restaurants, and bars, bring them to our eco-savvy design center and workshop, and turn them into unique goods for the hospitality industry. Upcycling is a much more efficient process than recycling!

Our goal is to demonstrate the process of upcycling using it as a tool to educate and inspire kids, teachers, and adults alike to think about sustainabilty!. We would like to give guided tours of our factory to the community and host field trips for local schools in and around San Diego. During the tour kids will arrive with a 12 oz bottle and leave 40 minutes later with a juice glass. In the process, we will show them a short video, tour the showroom, the factory and hand them a finished re-purposed product on their way out the door!

These tours will spark the imagination of everyone, kids, parents and teachers to think about a change in our community, our state, and our planet!  Upon completion of the tour everyone will also receive a certificate for their attendance to our facility and info on how to get involved in the community and lead change!

Your donation will help us achieve our goal of educating our community on sustainability. Your donations will help us attract a leader for our program who will design and build the educational content to make our shop tours an effective educational tool. We will produce a short informational video on the local and global problem and how everyone can make environmentally conscious choices. We will kid-proof our production facility in order to maintain rigorous safety standards during tours, provide proper safety gear to all guests, including masks and goggles, and deliver a snack at the conclusion of the tour!

To express our thanks and appreciation for your donations we will provide you with a gift from our eco-savvy line of glassware and jewelry. If you are unable to donate, please support our quest to reduce waste, create local jobs and educate youth on sustainability by sharing this campaign. Check us out at bottlesandwood.com as well as our facebook page facebook.com/bottleswood.

story:
Tiger and Dylan X Save Our Globe's Future

BRING OUR EARTH TO YOUR CITY 

And...

A BIKE CHALLENGE

BIKE MORE, DRIVE LESS

3 BIG CHALLENGES, SAVE OUR MOTHER EARTH.


Short Summary

We, DYLAN and TIGER, are two typical global teenagers from Silicon Valley.

We believe that the bright futures and dreams that we and other teens cling to against the challenges of growing up are increasingly at risk due to the continued massive human abuse of the environment that is resulting in our unstoppably rising oceans (see below “BACKGROUND” for more on why we are scared). 

What We Need

Any money and volunteers gathered from our modest Earth Day 2015 campaign will go to powering our 3-pronged AME Globe campaign we are putting together to make a measureable difference to help insure that we kids – and our kids’ kids - enjoy a safe and wonderful future.

AME stands for “A Mobile Ecology”, and the Globe stands for our beautiful Earth.

We understand that most campaigns have but a single request – but the clock is ticking, and helping us with any of the three below ‘asks’ will be helpful to all teens, and all humans, everywhere.

Besides – we’re teenagers, and believe NOTHING is impossible. 

Please read the below three challenges - then below this, see the surprising perks we've been able to gather from all the adults that are supporting us in this venture:

(1) Endangered GLOBE world tour. To build awareness of the emerging global ecological dangers, we have concerned friends that are building 3-15 high visibility (120’) globes featuring endangered species atop it north pole that we can bring to any city on the planet once we have an invitation. We need your help to get your mayors across the planet to invite us to visit. We are initially targeting:

• New York (the UN, significant global/multinational/financial leadership representing many of the world’s largest CO2 players)

• San Francisco/Silicon Valley (key eco innovation center, many green mayors, an airport that could soon be underwater by the end of this century)

• Beijing and Shanghai (China leads the world in renewable energy investment, $56.3 billion in 2013 alone)1, and mostly

• Paris (home of 2015’s UN Climate Change Conference in Paris, this coming November the home to what could be most important eco summit in the history of humanity).

Click here to forward us your email, comments or requests for the globe.

(2) Collect then Distribute 422 (for 4/22/15 – Earth Day) Bike Stations, ideally totaling at least 4220 bikes worldwide!  To further the health of our planet and the evolution of the ‘shared economies’ that will save us - such as those of collaborative economy pioneers like UBER and AirBNB – we are requesting bike and cash donations and campaign volunteers to help us aggregate, then distribute, 422 bike stations across the planet in service to this 2015 Earth Day, 4/22/15.

The more cash and/or bikes you donate or buy, the greater the number of people that will travel without generating the CO2 that is threatening to eliminate the next ice age – and thus, increasing the chances that the continued steady ocean rise will slow. Please help us collect, buy, distribute, promote – and use - these bikes.

If you’d like to volunteer, click here to send us an email with your information.

(3) ONE DAY BIKE CHALLENGE.  We ask that you challenge yourself, your parents and all the other adult drivers your know to trade in your car or limos for a bike for one day, capture this experience as still picture or video, then send it to us and/or post it on social media on ameGlobe.world for all to see and be inspired by.

We also ask that you each take responsibility for challenging three more people to take, then record, our challenge.

Finally, we also ask that you help us invite the celebrities that we teens most greatly respect to take our challenge, capture their biking experience via camera or film, then send it to us and/or post it on social media for all to see and be inspired by.

We choose President Obama, Candidate Clinton and CEO Cook as the celebrities we most hope to join us because we not only admire each of them, but also know that all three of them attended last year’s Eco Summit in New York, and know that they know what we are talking about – and fear. We also know that each of these celebrities cares about the future of Earth’s children – their future voters and consumers.

If you’d like to get involved, click here to send us an email with your information, or submit images and stories of your bike challenge experience.

See below The RULES AND PAY IT FORWARD for more information on the ONE DAY BIKE CHALLENGE FOR THE GLOBE.

THE RULES: 

Each person, once challenged to our ONE DAY BIKE CHALLENGE, has one week to comply or forfeit by making a financial donation to our site to enable someone else to have access to a bike. Within a week of being challenged participants must announce their acceptance via social media or email to our site, then record a video or take a photo of them riding a bike.  Finally, they must also nominate at least three more persons to participate in the challenge.

OUR CHALLENGE:  Dear President Obama, Secretary Clinton and CEO Cook – you, along with others, are hereby challenged to give up a car or limo for a day for a bike.  If – or others explicitly challenged – don’t do this, in the least we ask you to either buy a bike from our website or donate a bike worth at least $99. 

PAY IT FORWARD: The rule to nominate others are derivative of the notion of “Pay It Forward” which “is an expression for describing the beneficiary of a good deed repaying it to others instead of to the original benefactor.”[1] The concept is old, but the need for Pay It Forward thinking if more vital than ever!

[1] http://www.payitforward.foundation/pages/fundraiser-challenge?gclid=Cj0KEQjw6tepBRDLqLnxouaY_pkBEiQAPIOiBnLen8TzP7mzh2QoOx-ZeGQ_TSte40S18mhm5D4Gg6kaAq1M8P8HAQ


What You Get

We are also offering some very atypically cool gifts thanks to the adults that are supporting us (See Perks to the Right)

As for other benefit, while is unlikely that we will be able to quantify M/Tons of CO2 saved by your actions with the bikes, the real benefit will be getting more and more people out of their cars or limos and on to bikes (and mass transportation, and telecommuting from home).

The greater the number of global humans that see our site and video, or see and use the free bikes we give away for shared use, or see our 120’ globes we hope to deliver across the planet, the greater the number of humans – and their politicians - whom will ideally experience both positive behavior changes and shifts in attitude towards sustainability and against CO2.

Both the bike challenge and the Globe Tour will continue to raise awareness against the loud and uninformed voices of those who seek to deny global ecological change.


Our Challenges

This eco-action does have real challenges:

• Determining which cities get the globes

• Paying for the globe's transportation

• Minimizing collateral CO2 transmission associates with building and shipping the globes

• Finding volunteers in 422 cities to help us stage and maintain the bikes

• Collecting and optimally sharing any and all positive (and negative) social media response we receive from other kids, their adults – and celebrities that care!

• Keeping our optimism – despite ever more ominous signs of doom.


Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to donating, volunteering via email and/or helping us get the word out the following are other things you can do to help all of us have a better and real future:

1. Wake up and mount your own 'real' eco behavior change campaign.

2. Look at the kids you love – and take real ACTION for them/us; we are YOUR future.

3. Find a way to express your voice before this next November’s Eco Summit in Paris; stay tuned to the UN Foundation’s Action2015.org website for activities near you.

4. Read HIGH TIDE ON MAINSTREAM by John Englander

5. Support the production and distribution of ANY media content that is science-based and logically explain where things are going – and more importantly, what we can modestly do to slow down the rise of, and acidification from CO2 of, the oceans

6. Listen to your gut when it comes to determining which information regarding the environment is valuable versus constructed by those who lose as we generate less CO2

7. Start thinking about how we can help the folks that live closest to sea-level

8. Start thinking about inventions that can cool the ice, capture CO2 and help the oceans retrieve their alkalinity

9. Make Peace not War:  we will only survive if we can learn to live collaborative within shared economies that are integrated across the planet

10. Enjoy your NOW.  Every minute, every breath, is a gift.


In Conclusion

With a positive response from celebrities, such as President Obama, Candidate Clinton and CEO Cook, we would hope for an exponential growth in the number of people that will see our site, and increasingly,  dedicate energy and heart to protecting our precious planet.

We - Tiger X and Dylan X- hope to sufficiently wake up enough of a modest subset of humanity in time to change attitudes and behaviors sufficiently to help guarantee a future life for all of us present and future adults and kids - a life as wonderful as the lives that our parents ourselves enjoyed and have, until now, taken for granted.

Please let us know your liked our campaign, and how you might help. 

And please donate, volunteer, send us your emails, images, videos and letters to AMEGlobe.world. Enjoy our Perks(!) – and in general, helps us continue to “Pay it Forward”. Click here to submit!

Thank you!
Dylan X and Tiger X (and Mr. David Traub)


Please forward us your introductions, email, comments, images, videos or mayoral requests for the globe to ameGlobe.world.

Or contact the project producer: DavidCTraub@yahoo.com

© Copyright 2015. All Globe-associated Copyrights and Trademarks are owned by Dylan and Tiger X.

A Mobile Globe coffee maker


A Mobile Globe t-shirt


Bear Paint


For you contribution of $6,000, you’ll receive Small painting of bear from Dylann X.


For you contribution of $9,000, you’ll receive Large painting of bear from Dylann X.

Tiger Paint


For you contribution of $9,000, you’ll receive Small painting of tiger from Tiger X.


For you contribution of $9,000, you’ll receive Large painting of tiger from Tiger X.

Tiger and Dylan X Save Our Globe's Future

BRING OUR EARTH TO YOUR CITY 
And...
A BIKE CHALLENGE
BIKE MORE, DRIVE LESS
3 BIG CHALLENGES, SAVE OUR MOTHER EARTH.

Short Summary
We, DYLAN
and TIGER, are two typical global teenagers from Silicon
Valley. 


We
believe that the bright futures and dreams that we and other teens
cling to against the challenges of growing up are increasingly at
risk due to the continued massive human abuse of the environment that
is resulting in our unstoppably rising oceans (see below “BACKGROUND”
for more on why we are scared). What We Need

Any
money and volunteers gathered from our modest Earth Day 2015 campaign
will go to powering our 3-pronged AME Globe campaign we are
putting together to make a measureable difference to help insure that
we kids – and our kids’ kids - enjoy a safe and wonderful future.


AME
stands for “A Mobile Ecology”, and the Globe stands for our
beautiful Earth.
We
understand that most campaigns have but a single request – but the
clock is ticking, and helping us with any of the three below ‘asks’
will be helpful to all teens, and all humans, everywhere.


Besides
– we’re teenagers, and believe NOTHING is impossible.  



Please
read the below three challenges - then below this, see
the surprising perks
we've been able to gather from all the adults that are supporting us
in this venture:


(1)
Endangered GLOBE world tour. To
build awareness of the emerging global ecological dangers, we have
concerned friends that are building 3-15 high visibility (120’)
globes featuring endangered species atop it north pole that we can
bring to any city on the planet once we have an invitation. We need
your help to get your mayors across the planet to invite us to visit.
We are initially targeting:


•
New York (the UN, significant global/multinational/financial
leadership  representing many of the world’s largest CO2 players)
•
San Francisco/Silicon Valley (key eco innovation center, many green
mayors, an airport that could soon be underwater by the end of this
century)
•
Beijing and Shanghai (China leads the world in renewable energy
investment, $56.3 billion in 2013 alone)1,
and mostly
•
Paris (home of 2015’s UN Climate
Change Conference
in Paris,
this coming November the home to what could be most important eco
summit in the history of humanity).


Click here to forward us your email, comments or requests for the globe.


(2)
Collect then Distribute 422 (for 4/22/15 – Earth Day) Bike
Stations, ideally totaling at least 4220 bikes worldwide!  To
further the health of our planet and the evolution of the ‘shared
economies’ that will save us - such as those of collaborative
economy pioneers like UBER and AirBNB – we are requesting bike and
cash donations and campaign volunteers to help us aggregate, then
distribute, 422 bike stations across the planet in service to this
2015 Earth Day, 4/22/15.


The
more cash and/or bikes you donate or buy, the greater the number of
people that will travel without generating the CO2 that is
threatening to eliminate the next ice age – and thus, increasing
the chances that the continued steady ocean rise will slow.  Please
help us collect, buy, distribute, promote – and use - these bikes.


If you’d like to volunteer, click here to send us an email with your information.


(3)
ONE DAY BIKE CHALLENGE.  We ask
that you challenge yourself, your parents and all the other adult
drivers your know to trade in your car or limos for a bike for one
day, capture this experience as still picture or video, then send it
to us and/or post it on social media on ameGlobe.world for all to see
and be inspired by.  



We
also ask that you each take responsibility for challenging three more
people to take, then record, our challenge.


Finally,
we also ask that you help us invite the
celebrities that we teens most greatly respect to take our challenge,
capture their biking experience via camera or film, then send it to
us and/or post it on social media for all to see and be inspired by. 



We
choose President Obama, Candidate Clinton and CEO Cook as the
celebrities we most hope to join us because we not only admire each
of them, but also know that all three of them attended last year’s
Eco Summit in New York, and know that they know what we are talking
about – and fear. We also know that each of these celebrities cares
about the future of Earth’s children – their future voters and
consumers.
If you’d like to get involved, click here to send us an email with your information, or submit images and stories of your bike challenge experience.


See
below The RULES AND PAY IT FORWARD
for more information on the ONE DAY

story:
Summary

Each year, landowners approach the Upper Peninsula Land Conservancy (UPLC), seeking to protect their lands with the hope of establishing a legal conservation easement. Many of these landowners - although land rich - are cash poor, and find they cannot afford the stewardship costs to protect their own lands from future development.

UPLC has recently established the Forever Fund to join the community with those landowners. Using the interest accrued from donations (like those you give today), UPLC will be able help landowners protect lands they already own from future development.

The Upper Peninsula of Michigan is a place of incredible beauty and vast biodiversity, vulnerable to development seen in surrounding areas. I, a native of the U.P., will be walking across Portugal (over 380 miles, or in U.P. terms, roughly the distance from Ironwood to Drummond Island) starting in mid-June 2013 to raise awareness and funds to benefit the UPLC’s Forever Fund. My goal is to raise $3800, or $10 for every mile I will trek.

The funds I hope to raise through this campaign are only part of a larger picture. UPLC is a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit, with just under 3,000 acres of U.P. Lands already under protection. Since 1999, the UPLC has been dedicated to preserving the U.P. quality of life by protecting U.P. lands, forever.

Tell Me More!

On this trek, I will start in Lisbon and head north across Portugal by foot, ending in Santiago de Compostela, Spain. I will walk approximately 23 miles each day (for four weeks), rain or shine, carrying all supplies on my back. I will be following an established trail, called the Camino Portuguese, which is part of a medieval trail network extending across Europe.

The symbol of the trail is the scallop sea shell. In medieval times, pilgrims who completed the trail would see the ocean for the first time in their lives, walking to the end of their known world. They would collect a scallop shell from beaches from the Atlantic Coast and return home with shells as proof of completing the arduous journey.

With a small donation, you can join this journey and even receive a shell of your own as a token of my gratitude and that of landowners you are helping. All funds raised will go to UPLC’s Forever Fund. Together, we can preserve U.P. lands, forever.

Why aren't you walking across the U.P.? 

I'm a young lady hiking solo. The Upper Peninsula is home to wolves, bears, and cougars. While the prescence of apex predators is a great indication of how healthy the ecosystem is, carrying food and camping with apex predators around won't lead to a restful night's sleep, which I'd like during my summer vacation. 

Why Bother Donating?

Stewardship costs (consisting of start-up fees, insurance, and annual monitoring) are the #1 reason most landowners cannot protect their lands. The Forever Fund seeks to eliminate this obstacle; by raising enough funds into the Forever Fund, landowners who want to protect their lands will be able to do so, no matter their financial status. The more land that is protected from development in the U.P., the healthier the environment is as a whole. The development of the Marquette area is a prime example of the rapid expansion occurring in the U.P., a trend that will only continue without land protection. UPLC works by assisting landowners already interested in conservation through the land conservation process.

The wilderness of the U.P. fueled my love of the natural world. I've explored all seven continents and eventually returned closer to home. I've worked at UPLC since August 2012, and although I will be leaving to for graduate school to study environmental engineering this fall, I strongly believe in UPLC’s land protection mission. I believe so strongly, in fact, that I'm happy to give four weeks of my life to walk across a country and raise money and awareness for an organization I've grown to love. 100% of the funds you donate go to land protection (minus indigogo's admin costs) - I'm paying for the travel and equipment costs myself.

But I Just Can’t Give You Cash

Together, even the most humble contributions make a huge difference for U.P. lands. However, if donating money just isn’t an option right now, please help spread the word. Leave a comment in the "Comments" tab at the top of this page, share this campaign on your favorite social network, and “Like” the Upper Peninsula Land Conservancy on Facebook. Thank you for your time and support – together, we can preserve the U.P. quality of life by protecting U.P. lands, forever!

story:
Qui sommes nous?
Salut! Nous sommes les membres de JVE Sokodé. JVE, ce sont les "Jeunes Volontaires pour l'Environnement". Nous observons les effets du changement climatique dans notre milieu et nous sommes disposés de prendre l'initiative et changer les conditions de vie pour nous et les générations futures.

Que voulons-nous?

Au niveau local, nous voulons augmenter la conscience sur les avantages des énergies renouvelables. De plus, nous commençons à élever l’efficacité énergétique des foyers aujourd’hui.

Pourquoi nous appuyer?
Avec votre appui et notre engagement, nous allons planter des arbres et promouvoir des lampes solaires pour fournir aux communautés l’énergie renouvelable. Grâce à des foyers améliorés nous réalisons deux objectifs à même temps : nous réduisons les dangers pour la santé causée par la fumée des foyers traditionnels et nous réduisons la quantité du bois nécessaire pour faire la cuisine.

Quelles activités nous réalisons?

  • Organisation des séances de sensibilisation et de formation dans les écoles primaires et l’école secondaire sur la protection de l’environnement
  • Aménagement des lieux pour le reboisement en collaboration avec la mairie (espaces vertes sur le terrain publique), les établissements et des personnes privées
  • Organisation des séances de reboisement à Koma 3 et Fazao (mis en terre de 1000 plants pour la production de bois énergie)
  • Exposition et vente des foyers améliorés et lampes solaires dans les lieux publiques et service (marché, préfecture…). Les foyers améliorés et lampes solaires sont fournis par le Bureau Exécutive de JVE.
  • Organisation d’une émission radio sur la problématique du changement climatique et de protection de l’environnement (utilisation des énergies renouvelables, l’efficacité énergétique, foyers améliorés, carbonisation amélioré comme quelques approches de solution)
  • Ouverture d’un Bureau Local de JVE-SOKODE pour ses activités et pour sa visibilité

Et avec quel budget?
La réalisation de toutes ces activités est basée sur le bénévolat. Malgré notre engagement, nous avons besoin de ressources financières pour le matériel, la communication et la coordination. Le budget global du projet se chiffre à 1560 US Dollar. JVE Sokodé apporte 260 dollar au budget. Ainsi, nous cherchons le montant de 1300 US dollar.

Quels sont les effets?
Nous créons des conditions permettant de réduire la déforestation par l'utilisation abusive de bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois. Spécifiquement, nous attendons les effets suivants :

  • Conscience élevée sur les problématiques du changement climatique parmi la population de Sokodé
  • Espaces de production du bois énergie pour l’utilisation domestique et pour la fabrication du charbon de bois par la carbonisation améliorée
  • Accès facile à l’énergie renouvelable et foyers améliorés
  • Visibilité augmentée de la Branche Locale dans la préfecture

Notre projet est accompagné par les organisations JVE International et Glocal Ahead ! qui ont déjà réalisé des projets pareils et qui nous appuieront avec leur expertise.

Quels sont les défis?
Ce projet repose fortement sur l'acceptation des énergies renouvelables dans la localité. Pour favoriser cette acceptation, des autorités sont impliqués, comme la Direction Préfectorale de l’Environnement et le Bureau de la préfecture de Tchaoudjo. En outre, nous pouvons présenter des témoinages concrets d’autres projets similaires dans le réseau de JVE International.

Et la durabilité?
Comme nous agissons dans notre vosinage, nous serons sur place bien après l’implémentation du projet. Un suivi régulier sera organisé par nos membres dans les lieux de réalisation du projet, surtout le suivi des jeunes plants. Les bénéficiaires seront constamment chargés de la surveillance, de la protection et du renouvellement des actions menées.

Partagez notre projet avec vos amis!
-> Partagez le lien de notre projet sur facebook, twitter, par email... Plus des personnes qui connaissent notre projet, plus d'opportunités de succès! Merci pour votre soutien!!

promouvoir des lampes solaires pour fournir aux communautés l’énergie
renouvelable. Grâce à des foyers améliorés nous réalisons deux objectifs à même
temps : nous réduisons les dangers pour la santé causée par la fumée des
foyers traditionnels et nous réduisons la quantité du bois nécessaire pour faire
la cuisine.



Quelles activités nous
réalisons?



Organisation des séances
de sensibilisation et de formation dans
les écoles primaires et l’école secondaire sur la protection de l’environnement
Aménagement des lieux
pour le reboisement en collaboration avec la mairie (espaces vertes sur le terrain
publique), les établissements et des personnes privées
Organisation des séances
de reboisement à Koma 3 et Fazao (mis en terre de 1000 plants pour la production de
bois énergie)
Exposition et vente des
foyers améliorés et lampes solaires dans les lieux publiques et service
(marché, préfecture…). Les foyers améliorés et lampes solaires sont fournis par
le Bureau Exécutive de JVE.
Organisation d’une
émission radio sur la problématique du changement climatique et de protection
de l’environnement (utilisation des énergies renouvelables, l’efficacité
énergétique, foyers améliorés, carbonisation amélioré comme quelques approches
de solution)
Ouverture d’un Bureau
Local de JVE-SOKODE pour ses activités et pour sa visibilité 



Et avec
quel budget?La réalisation de toutes ces activités est basée sur le bénévolat. Malgré
notre engagement, nous avons besoin de ressources financières pour le matériel,
la communication et la coordination. Le budget global du projet se chiffre à 1560 US Dollar. JVE Sokodé apporte 260 dollar au budget. Ainsi, nous cherchons le montant de 1300 US dollar.


Quels
sont les effets?Nous créons des
conditions permettant de réduire la déforestation par l'utilisation abusive de
bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois.
Spécifiquement, nous attendons les effets suivants :






Conscience élevée sur les problématiques du
changement climatique parmi la population de Sokodé
Espaces de production du bois énergie pour
l’utilisation domestique et pour la fabrication du charbon de bois par la
carbonisation améliorée

Accès facile à l’énergie renouvelable et foyers
améliorés
Visibilité augmentée de la Branche Locale dans la préfecture




Notre projet est accompagné par les organisations JVE
International et Glocal Ahead ! qui ont déjà réalisé des projets pareils
et qui nous appuieront avec leur expertise.
Quels
sont les défis?Ce projet repose fortement sur l'acceptation des énergies renouvelables dans la
localité. Pour favoriser cette acceptation, des
autorités sont impliqués, comme la Direction Préfectorale de l’Environnement et le Bureau de la
préfecture de Tchaoudjo. En outre, nous
pouvons présenter des témoinages concrets d’autres projets similaires dans le
réseau de JVE International.




Et la
durabilité?Comme nous agissons dans notre vosinage, nous serons sur place bien après
l’implémentation du projet. Un suivi régulier sera organisé par nos membres dans
les lieux de réalisation du projet, surtout le suivi des
jeunes plants. Les bénéficiaires
seront constamment chargés de la surveillance, de la protection et du
renouvellement des actions menées.


Partagez notre projet avec
vos amis!-> Partagez le lien de notre projet sur facebook, twitter, par
email... Plus des personnes qui connaissent notre projet, plus d'opportunités
de succès! Merci
pour votre soutien!!

story:
Greywater Study- 1st of its kind

Greywater Action is conducting a study of 100 simple greywater systems in California. Greywater reuse has the potential to save up to 50% of residential water use, saving water, time and money. So, why isn't everyone using greywater and every water district promoting it?

Data gap

There is a lack of scientific data on how these system function and how they affect soils and plants. Our study will find out how these systems function over time, how much maintenance is required, and will look at affects to soils and plants from products people use.

We'll share all our findings with the public and policy makers.

Why our study is important

We know greywater has the potential to save tens of thousands of gallons of water for a home, reduce flows into overloaded sewers and septic systems, grow food and greenery, while saving time, money, and encouraging healthier products to be used! There are so many potential benefits to greywater. Our study will offer much needed information on how greywater systems are functioning in the real world, promote best practices, and help to mainstream greywater reuse.

We just need $2,000 dollars to complete the study.

Please help us reach our goal!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this with your friends and family. To keep updated sign up for our email list at www.greywateraction.org
