story:
Our Project – Marvelous, Magical MOSS Gardening Book


Support in a truly GREEN environmental project to promote sustainable landscapes by helping me publish a unique book about moss gardening to be entitled, The Magical Realm of Eco-friendly Mosses – A Practical Guide to Moss Gardening Projects.


I’m Annie Martin, also known as “Mossin' Annie.” As a recognized expert in using bryophytes (mosses) as a horticultural choice, I will provide insights into the aesthetic, botanical and environmental reasons for choosing mosses which will distinguish this book in the marketplace. Written in a conversational style that will appeal to the lay person, this easy-to-read guide will serve as a valuable reference for gardeners, landscapers, environmentalists, and educators around the world. In addition to meeting an educational goal to spread the moss word, this publication will posture my entrepreneurial business, Mountain Moss Enterprises, as an innovative leader in the emerging LIVE moss industry.



The Impact – Greening Our World With MOSS


As people have become more environmentally conscious, there has been a growing interest in mosses. These amazing plants are not only beautiful with their year-round green but they offer solutions to environmental concerns of groundwater contamination, erosion control, and reducing air pollution. Because of their unique botanical characteristics, mosses require NO chemicals – NO fertilizers, NO pesticides, and NO herbicides – in contrast to common practices used in traditional landscaping and lawn maintenance.


It has been a challenge for gardeners to move beyond myths and generalizations about these miniature plants and to proceed with proven methods for success that are bryophyte specific. Indeed, all mosses don't just live on the north side or in the shade. In fact, there are many types that even tolerate sun exposures. Many people have expressed interest in the publication of a moss book that highlights a variety of innovative and sustainable approaches for “greening” our urban environments. The Magical Realm of Eco-friendly Mosses will fill an information void on topics not covered in the handful of print references currently available in the international marketplace.


My book will explore benefits of bryophytes as a green alternative for innovative landscapes, moss lawns, living walls and green roofs. By promoting the benefits of mosses as a plant choice and providing expert planting advice, this book will enable people to embrace these fascinating plants!



What We Need – Raising the Green MOSS $$$


As a entrepreneur and leader in the moss movement, I need your financial support to help make this book a reality. Donations will be used to proceed with writing this valuable reference and publishing an eBook and a soft cover print version. By publishing in a variety of formats, we can reach a wider target market as we disseminate our “mossy” philosophy. Our outstanding photography will enhance the informative content.


To publish a book requires more than just writing a good manuscript. The myriad of functions in the process includes the following steps:

  • designing an appealing layout;

  • editing and proofing for accuracy;

  • ensuring a user-friendly cross-referenced index

  • acquiring necessary ISBN, LCCN, SAN registration for worldwide retail sales and easier accessioning by libraries;

  • obtaining a copyright to protect intellectual property;

  • preparing files for ebook formats and print Publishing on Demand (POD) books;

  • developing effective marketing strategies;

  • implementing distribution.

A portion of the budget will be allocated to cover basic living expenses while writing the book. Other functions will be addressed by utilizing my professional background in graphic design, photography and print production with assistance from other freelance contractors. An editing team composed of a professional editor, experienced proofer, expert indexer, respected bryologist, and typical readers, will be an essential component to ensure quality of the publications. Funds will also cover actual publishing costs, administrative functions and fees associated with official registrations, and to initiate an effective marketing campaign.


After raising necessary funds, writing of the manuscript will begin in late Fall 2011 with the goal of producing a draft copy by late Winter. By Spring, we expect to send both the ebook and the print versions to the publishers. We have targeted early Summer for the official book release date. Through effective marketing and with a “little help from our friends”, we anticipate a positive response and significant sales by the end of 2012.


We project that book sales will provide “bread and butter” capital for Mountain Moss Enterprises throughout the year especially during the winter holiday season when typical landscaping projects slow down. Profits from this book will be funneled into more books... and continued educational outreach, cultivation research as well as groundbreaking projects.



Benefits for YOU – Major Cool MOSS Perks


In addition to the mossy smile you'll have from being a contributor to this green project, you will receive a personally written “thank-you” note and exceptional gifts. ALL contributors will be acknowledged in the book credits and on our Web site: www.mountainmoss.com. Whether you can give a little or a lot, you can be assured that your donation will be greatly appreciated.



How YOU Can Help EVEN MORE – Spreading the MOSS Word


We'll appreciate all of your efforts to promote our Indiegogo funding campaign as well as assist in promoting the book sales through your own personal contacts and social networking vehicles. Help us achieve our goals through one of the best marketing methods – “word of mouth.” At our Web site, we've even prepared a sample email for your use in contacting friends and colleagues. Please give a big shout-out... Go Green With Moss!



Want To Learn More about Our Moss Book Project?


This concise proposal is a summary of our book project. If you'd like to learn more, we've prepared a more detailed plan that is posted on our Web site: www.mountainmoss.com. While you are there, we invite you to peruse our Web site to learn more about mosses and our entrepreneurial business, Mountain Moss Enterprises. On Facebook, please join our Go Green With Moss group where you can find frequent posts including photographs of recent moss gardening projects. We'll post regular updates on Indiegogo.com so that you can follow our book progress.



Concluding Remarks – MOSSY Thanks


I have approached all my business dealings in good spirit and I've really enjoyed sharing my passion for mosses with others. Despite hardships of starting a niche business in an economic recession, I have been determined to promote the environmental value of mosses through a variety of avenues and maintain a positive vision. Publishing this book is critical next step in our educational mission and desire to share the joys and advantages of mosses.


THANKS for pitching in and believing in the value of my moss journey. DONATE NOW and together we can make this book happen. Join my team of supporters for the publication of Mossin' Annie's first book... The Magical Realm of Eco-friendly Mosses – A Practical Guide to Moss Gardening Projects.

story:
Executive summary:

My name is Eric Parage. I am a French citizen and live in Dominican Republic since five years after having traveled extensively most of my life. I’ve literally fell in love with the country and the people therefore I’ve decided to settle down in this stunning nature to raise my kid.

In 2013, my interest in the Dominican art led me to meet with local artist and I have created a website to support local craftwork (www.artesania-dominicano.com). This was the first milestone to a more ambitious project: sharing the Dominican jewel by creating a new concept of eco-lodge: The SeaSunEco Dominicano

Nestled in one of the most beautiful area of the island, the eco-lodge will be entirely self-sufficient with the capacity of 16 guests divided into 4 bungalows surrounding a central building with restaurant, bar, terrace and green pool. Construction will be made of natural materials to reduce our ecological footprint and minimize the overall cost of the project.

The aim of the eco-lodge is to offer visitors the opportunity to be engaged in eco-solutions by participating and sharing experience. Various activities will be proposed to get a chance to learn how solar energy works, how to reduce or recycle waste, to grow organic food…and more.

The SeaSunEco Dominicano is meant to become an interactive platform of knowledge sharing, a place where vacation is rewarding for all.

The site will welcome all kind of clients, from individual to family and groups with a particular emphasis to workshops focusing on environmental topics.

The overall budget of 200,000 euros as described below:

€ 50,000: purchase of land + associated government fees

€ 60,000: building material + labor

€ 25,000: architects fees + administrative costs + miscellaneous

€ 65,000: first year running fees

To start the project, crowdfunding will be flexible to be able to finalize the drawings, purchase the land and devote effort to make it happen.

You will have the opportunity to acquired vouchers that will correspond to “booking days” at SeaSunEco Dominicano.

1 day = 150 euros

1 week (5 nights/6 days) = 600 euros

Green card (1 week for two adults) = 1200 euros

You are also very welcome to help us by supporting our project or subscribing to our newsletter. Broadcasts will be available on our website to follow us on our latest activities and events.

Associate your name to SeaSunEco Dominicano by acquiring a “Solar Plant” for 5,000 euros. These Solar Plants will symbolize the heart of our eco-lodge by providing energy and comfort to our guests. They represent the combination of the latest technology associated with local raw material, a symbol to express that our future is founded on our heritage.

Indeed, this project is for me the most tangible way to share my willingness to protect the environment, to preserve the harmony between nature and men, and to share findings with everyone.

I want this eco-lodge to be a friendly place where people can understand our complex environmental issues and experience simple eco-solutions; an eco-lodge where guests can relax in a pleasant area and also contribute, if they wish, to make this place a jewel of peacefulness.

Your help is invaluable to this project. If you cannot contribute financially I will understand, and I will just ask you to spread the word. The Indiegogo site has tools to do so. Maybe you know someone who can help. There are maybe among you people with special skills (e.g. construction, organic food, etc…) that can participate in the development and contribute in some way or another. Any help whatsoever will be valuable. Trust me.

I personally thank you all and hope to meet you at SeaSunEco Dominicano

Résumé:

Mon nom est Eric Parage. Je suis citoyen français et je vis en République Dominicaine depuis cinq ans après avoir voyagé toute ma vie. Je suis littéralement tombé amoureux du pays et des gens, j'ai donc décidé de m'installer dans cette magnifique nature et y élever mon enfant.

En 2013, mon intérêt pour l'art Dominicain m'a amené à rencontrer un artiste local, et j'ai créé un site Internet pour soutenir l'artisanat local (www.artesania-dominicano.com). Ce fut la première étape vers un projet plus ambitieux: le partage de la beauté de la République Dominicaine en créant un nouveau concept d'éco-lodge: Le SeaSunEco-Dominicano

Niché dans l'un des plus beaux endroits de l'île, l'éco-lodge sera entièrement auto-suffisant avec une capacité de 16 personnes réparties en 4 bungalows autour d'un bâtiment central avec restaurant, bar, terrasse et piscine naturelle. La construction sera faite de matériaux naturels pour réduire notre empreinte écologique et réduire le coût global du projet.

L'objectif de l'éco-lodge est d'offrir aux visiteurs la possibilité d'être engagés dans les éco-solutions en participant et en partageant l'expérience. Diverses activités seront proposées pour apprendre comment fonctionne l'énergie solaire, la façon de réduire ou recycler les déchets, cultiver de la nourriture organique ... et plus encore.

Le SeaSunEco-Dominicano est destiné à devenir une plate-forme interactive de partage des connaissances, un endroit où les vacances seront enrichissante pour tous.

Le site accueillera toutes sortes de clients, de l'individu à la famille et aux groupes avec un accent particulier à des ateliers portant sur des sujets environnementaux.

Le budget global de 200.000 euros, comme décrit ci-dessous:

€ 50 000: achat de terrain + frais gouvernementaux associés

€ 60 000: matériaux de construction + main d'oeuvre

€ 25 000: honoraires d'architectes + les coûts administratifs + divers

€ 65 000: frais de fonctionnement de la première année

Pour démarrer le projet, le crowdfunding sera flexible pour être en mesure de finaliser les plans, d'acheter le terrain, créer le site web et 

Vous aurez la possibilité de benéficier de contreparties qui correspondent à des "jours de réservation" à SeaSunEco-Dominicano.

1 jour = € 150

1 semaine (5 nuits / 6 jours) = € 600

Carte verte (1 semaine pour deux adultes) = € 1200

Vous êtes également les bienvenus pour nous aider en soutenant notre projet. Des mises a jour seront disponibles sur notre site Web et notre page facebook pour nous suivre et connaitre nos dernières activités et événements.

Associez votre nom à SeaSunEco-Dominicano par l'acquisition d'une "centrale solaire" pour 5000 euros. Ces centrales solaires feront symboliser le cœur de notre éco-lodge en fournissant de l'énergie et le confort à nos clients. Ils représentent la combinaison de la technologie de pointe associée à des matières premières locales, un symbole pour exprimer que notre avenir repose sur notre patrimoine.

En effet, ce projet est pour moi le moyen le plus tangible de partager ma volonté de protéger l'environnement, pour préserver l'harmonie entre la nature et les hommes, et de partager les résultats avec tout le monde.

Je veux que cet éco-lodge soit un lieu convivial où les gens peuvent comprendre nos problèmes environnementaux et éco-solutions; un éco-lodge où vous pourrez vous détendre dans un cadre agréable et contribuer également, si vous le souhaitez, a faire de cet endroit un bijou de quiétude.

Votre aide est précieuse pour ce projet. Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement je comprends, et je vais vous demander de faire passer le message. Le site Indiegogo met des outils a votre disposition pour ceci. Peut-être que vous connaissez quelqu'un qui peut nous aider. Il ya peut-être parmi vous des personnes ayant des compétences particulières (par exemple: la construction, la nourriture organique, l'énergie renouvelable, etc ...) qui peuvent participer au développement et y contribuer d'une manière ou d'une autre. Toute aide quelle que ce soit sera précieuse. Croyez-moi.

Je vous remercie tous personellement et espère vous rencontrer bientot à SeaSunEco-Dominicano...

Resumen ejecutivo:

Mi nombre es Eric Parage. Soy un ciudadano francés y vivo en República Dominicana desde hace cinco años después de haber viajado mucho por la mayor parte de mi vida. Literalmente, he enamoré con el país y la gente, por lo tanto he decidido a establecerse en esta impresionante naturaleza para cuidar a mi hijo.

En 2013, mi interés en el arte dominicano me llevó a reunirse con el artista local y he creado un sitio web para apoyar la artesanía local (www.artesania-dominicano.com). Este fue el primer hito de un proyecto más ambicioso: compartir la joya Dominicana mediante la creación de un nuevo concepto de eco-lodge: El SeaSunEco-Dominicano.

Ubicado en una de las zonas más bellas de la isla, el eco-lodge será totalmente autosuficiente con la capacidad de 16 personas divididas en 4 bungalows que rodean un edificio central con restaurante, bar, terraza y piscina verde. La construcción se hizo con materiales naturales para reducir nuestra huella ecológica y minimizar el coste total del proyecto.

El objetivo de la eco-lodge es ofrecer a los visitantes la oportunidad de intervenir en las eco-soluciones mediante la participación y el intercambio de experiencias. Se proponen varias actividades para tener la oportunidad de aprender cómo funciona la energía solar, la manera de reducir o reciclar los residuos, para crecer orgánica de alimentos ... y más.

El SeaSunEco-Dominicano está destinado a convertirse en una plataforma interactiva de intercambio de conocimientos, un lugar donde las vacaciones es gratificante para todos.

El sitio dará la bienvenida a todo tipo de clientes, desde individuales a familiares y grupos con un énfasis particular a los talleres centrados en temas ambientales.

El presupuesto global de 200.000 euros, como se describe a continuación:

€ 50000: compra de tierras + tasas gubernamentales asociadas

€ 60.000: material de construcción + mano de obra

€ 25.000: honorarios de arquitectos + gastos administrativos + miscelánea

€ 65.000: honorarios de funcionamiento de primer año

Para iniciar el proyecto, crowdfunding será flexible para poder finalizar los dibujos, comprar la tierra y dedicar esfuerzo para que esto ocurra.

Usted tendrá la oportunidad de vales adquiridos que corresponderán a los "días de reserva" en SeaSunEco-Dominicano.

1 día = € 150

1 semana (5 noches / 6 días) = € 600

Tarjeta verde (1 semana para dos adultos) = € 1200

También son muy bienvenidos a ayudarnos mediante el apoyo a nuestro proyecto o suscribirse a nuestro boletín. Las transmisiones estarán disponibles en nuestro sitio web de seguirnos en nuestras últimas actividades y eventos.

Asociar su nombre a SeaSunEco-Dominicano mediante la adquisición de una "Planta Solar" por 5.000 euros. Estas plantas solares simbolizarán el corazón de nuestra eco-lodge, proporcionando energía y confort a nuestros huéspedes. Ellos representan la combinación de la última tecnología relacionados con las materias primas locales, un símbolo para expresar que nuestro futuro se basa en nuestra herencia.

De hecho, este proyecto es para mí la forma más tangible de compartir mi buena voluntad de proteger el medio ambiente, para preservar la armonía entre la naturaleza y los hombres, y para compartir los resultados con todo el mundo.

Quiero que este eco-lodge sea un lugar agradable donde la gente puede entender nuestros problemas ambientales complejos y experiencia sencilla eco-soluciones; un eco-lodge, donde los huéspedes pueden relajarse en una zona agradable y también contribuir, si así lo desean, para hacer de este lugar una joya de tranquilidad.

Tu ayuda es muy valiosa para este proyecto. Si no puede contribuir financieramente voy a entender, y simplemente le voy a preguntar a difundir la palabra. El sitio Indiegogo tiene herramientas para hacerlo. Tal vez conozcas a alguien que pueda ayudar. Hay tal vez entre vosotros personas con habilidades especiales (por ejemplo, construcción, alimentos orgánicos, etc ...) que pueden participar en el desarrollo y contribuir de una u otra manera. Cualquier ayuda en absoluto será valiosa. Confía en mí.

Personalmente, agradezco a todos y espero conocerte en

SeaSunEco-Dominicano...
story_txt:
Executive
summary:My
name is Eric Parage. I am a French citizen and live in Dominican
Republic since five years after having traveled extensively most of
my life. I’ve literally fell in love with the country and the
people therefore I’ve decided to settle down in this stunning
nature to raise my kid.


	In
2013, my
interest in the Dominican art led
me to
meet with local artist and I have created
a website to
support local craftwork (www.artesania-dominicano.com).
This was the first milestone to a more ambitious project: sharing the
Dominican jewel by creating a new concept of eco-lodge: The
SeaSunEco Dominicano


	Nestled
in one of the most beautiful area of the island, the eco-lodge will
be entirely self-sufficient with the capacity of 16 guests divided
into 4 bungalows surrounding a central building with restaurant, bar, terrace and green pool. Construction will be made of natural materials to reduce
our ecological footprint and minimize the overall cost of the
project.


	The
aim of the eco-lodge is to offer visitors the opportunity to be
engaged in eco-solutions by participating and sharing experience.
Various activities will be proposed to get a chance to learn how
solar energy works, how to reduce or recycle waste, to grow organic
food…and more.

The
SeaSunEco Dominicano is
meant to become an interactive platform of knowledge sharing, a place
where vacation is rewarding for all.


	The
site will welcome all kind of clients, from individual to family and
groups with a particular emphasis to workshops focusing on
environmental topics.  





	The
overall budget of 200,000
euros
as described below:


€ 50,000:
purchase of land + associated government fees

€ 60,000:
building material + labor

€ 25,000:
architects fees + administrative costs + miscellaneous

€ 65,000:
first year running fees


	To
start the project, crowdfunding will be flexible to be able to
finalize the drawings, purchase the land and devote effort to make it
happen. 



	You
will have the opportunity to acquired vouchers that will correspond
to “booking days” at SeaSunEco
Dominicano.


1
day = 150 euros

1
week (5 nights/6 days) = 600 euros

Green
card (1 week for two adults) = 1200 euros


	You
are also very welcome to help us by supporting our project or
subscribing to our newsletter. Broadcasts will be available on our
website to follow us on our latest activities and events.



	Associate
your name to SeaSunEco
Dominicano by
acquiring a “Solar
Plant”
for 5,000
euros.
These Solar Plants will symbolize the heart of our eco-lodge by
providing energy and comfort to our guests. They represent the
combination of the latest technology associated with local raw
material, a symbol to express that our future is founded on our
heritage.


	Indeed,
this project is for me the most tangible way to share my willingness
to protect the environment, to preserve the harmony between nature
and men, and to share findings with everyone.

I
want this eco-lodge to be a friendly place where people can
understand our complex environmental issues and experience simple
eco-solutions; an eco-lodge where guests can relax in a pleasant area
and also contribute, if they wish, to make this place a jewel of
peacefulness. 



	Your
help is invaluable to this project. If you cannot contribute
financially I will understand, and I will just ask you to spread the
word. The Indiegogo site has tools to do so. Maybe you know someone
who can help. There are maybe among you people with special skills
(e.g. construction, organic food, etc…) that can participate in the
development and contribute in some way or another. Any help
whatsoever will be valuable. Trust me.


	I
personally thank you all and hope to meet you at SeaSunEco
Dominicano





Résumé:



	Mon
nom est Eric Parage. Je suis citoyen français et je vis en
République Dominicaine depuis cinq ans après avoir voyagé toute ma
vie. Je suis littéralement tombé amoureux du pays et des gens, j'ai donc décidé de m'installer dans cette magnifique nature et y
élever mon enfant.


	En
2013, mon intérêt pour l'art Dominicain m'a amené à rencontrer un
artiste local, et j'ai créé un site Internet pour soutenir
l'artisanat local (www.artesania-dominicano.com). Ce fut la première
étape vers un projet plus ambitieux: le partage de la beauté de la
République Dominicaine en créant un nouveau concept d'éco-lodge:
Le
SeaSunEco-Dominicano



	Niché
dans l'un des plus beaux endroits de l'île, l'éco-lodge sera
entièrement auto-suffisant avec une capacité de 16 personnes
réparties en 4 bungalows autour d'un bâtiment central avec
restaurant, bar, terrasse et piscine naturelle. La construction sera faite de matériaux
naturels pour réduire notre empreinte écologique et réduire le
coût global du projet. 



	L'objectif
de l'éco-lodge est d'offrir aux visiteurs la possibilité d'être
engagés dans les éco-solutions en participant et en partageant
l'expérience. Diverses activités seront proposées pour apprendre comment fonctionne l'énergie solaire, la façon
de réduire ou recycler les déchets, cultiver de la nourriture
organique ... et plus encore. 


Le
SeaSunEco-Dominicano
est destiné à devenir une plate-forme interactive de partage des
connaissances, un endroit où les vacances seront enrichissante pour
tous. 



	Le
site accueillera toutes sortes de clients, de l'individu à la
famille et aux groupes avec un accent particulier à des ateliers
portant sur des sujets environnementaux. 



	Le
budget global de 200.000
euros,
comme décrit ci-dessous: 



€ 50
000: achat de terrain + frais gouvernementaux associés 


€ 60
000: matériaux de construction + main d'oeuvre 


€ 25
000: honoraires d'architectes  + les coûts administratifs + divers 


€ 65
000: frais de fonctionnement de la première année 



	Pour
démarrer le projet, le crowdfunding sera flexible pour être en
mesure de finaliser les plans, d'acheter le terrain, créer le site web et 








	Vous
aurez la possibilité de benéficier de contreparties qui correspondent à des "jours de réservation" à SeaSunEco-Dominicano.




1
jour = € 150 


1
semaine (5 nuits / 6 jours) = € 600 


Carte
verte (1 semaine pour deux adultes) = € 1200 



	Vous
êtes également les bienvenus pour nous aider en soutenant notre
projet. Des mises a jour
seront disponibles sur notre site Web et notre page facebook pour nous suivre et connaitre
nos dernières activités et événements.  



	Associez
votre nom à SeaSunEco-Dominicano
par l'acquisition d'une "centrale
solaire"
pour 5000
euros.
Ces centrales solaires feront symboliser le cœur de notre éco-lodge
en fournissant de l'énergie et le confort à nos clients. Ils
représentent la combinaison de la technologie de pointe associée à
des matières premières locales, un symbole pour exprimer que notre
avenir repose sur notre patrimoine. 



	En
effet, ce projet est pour moi le moyen le plus tangible de partager
ma volonté de protéger l'environnement, pour préserver l'harmonie
entre la nature et les hommes, et de partager les résultats avec
tout le monde. 


Je
veux que cet éco-lodge soit un lieu convivial où les gens peuvent
comprendre nos problèmes environnementaux et
éco-solutions; un éco-lodge où vous pourrez vous détendre dans un
cadre agréable et contribuer également, si vous le souhaitez, a
faire de cet endroit un bijou de quiétude. 



	Votre
aide est précieuse pour ce projet. Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer
financièrement je comprends, et je vais vous demander de faire passer le
message. Le site Indiegogo met des outils a votre disposition pour ceci. Peut-être que
vous connaissez quelqu'un qui peut nous aider. Il ya peut-être parmi
vous des personnes ayant des compétences particulières (par exemple: la construction, la nourriture organique, l'énergie renouvelable, etc ...) qui peuvent
participer au développement et y contribuer d'une manière ou d'une
autre. Toute aide quelle que ce soit sera précieuse. Croyez-moi. 



	Je
vous remercie tous personellement et espère vous rencontrer bientot
à SeaSunEco-Dominicano...

honorarios de funcionamiento de primer año

1
día = € 150

semana (5 noches / 6 días) = € 600

verde (1 semana para dos adultos) = € 1200

son muy bienvenidos a ayudarnos mediante el apoyo a nuestro proyecto
o suscribirse a nuestro boletín. Las transmisiones estarán
disponibles en nuestro sitio web de seguirnos en nuestras últimas
actividades y eventos.

mediante la adquisición de una "Planta
Solar"
por 5.000
euros.
Estas plantas solares simbolizarán el corazón de nuestra eco-lodge,
proporcionando energía y confort a nuestros huéspedes. Ellos
representan la combinación de la última tecnología relacionados
con las materias primas locales, un símbolo para expresar que
nuestro futuro se basa en nuestra herencia. 



De
hecho, este proyecto es para mí la forma más tangible de compartir
mi buena voluntad de proteger el medio ambiente, para preservar la
armonía entre la naturaleza y los hombres, y para compartir los
resultados con todo el mundo. 


Quiero
que este eco-lodge sea un lugar agradable donde la gente puede
entender nuestros problemas ambientales complejos y experiencia

relajarse en una zona agradable y también contribuir, si así lo
desean, para hacer de este lugar una joya de tranquilidad.

ayuda es muy valiosa para este proyecto. Si no puede contribuir

en el desarrollo y contribuir de una u otra manera. Cualquier ayuda

agradezco a todos y espero conocerte en 


SeaSunEco-Dominicano...

story:
Update!

We've made our goal!   We are ecstatic and can't thank our contributors enough, really!  What you've done will have a tangible and long-lasting effect on our Rio Dulce community and environment.

If we can raise just a bit more we can take it even further by building a small chocolate flavor lab.  Some basic equipment will allow us to make a "mini factory" that will give us insights into the flavor and quality of our cacao beans.  It would also allow us to offer visitors a true bean to bar experience.

Short Summary

Hello!  We are a family owned agro-forestry farm in Rio Dulce, Guatemala.  We have been growing and cultivating endangered hardwood trees and tropical fruits for almost three decades.   Our favorite part of the project is the heirloom cacao forest (the tree that makes cocoa). 

Our cacao is delicious, sustainably produced and friendly to the local community (whose ancestors have been cultivating the crop for at least 2,500 years!).  But, in order to provide chocolate makers and consumers with the best cocoa in the world, we need a proper fermentation plant.

A cocoa lab and fermentation center will help us make delicious cacao, which will help us sell our cacao, which in turn will help us keep our 15 full-time workers employed, our forest intact, and provide that much more chocolate to the world :)

What We Need

We need a great fermentation & drying center! 

Once harvested, good cacao needs to be fermented and dried. This is a crucial part of the process because it's what really brings out those amazing flavors and notes in your favorite dark chocolate. 

The problem is, a great fermentation center is a considerable investment; we need to build fermentation boxes, the structure around them, drying platforms, solar dryers and a packaging facility. 

The Impact

We love visitors!  Please come visit us on the farm so that you can see first-hand the biodiversity and ecological impact of a sustainable agro-forestry project.  We are a socially and environmentally responsible tree farm that has almost three decades of experience reforesting degraded land and protecting natural forest.  We have planted over 100,000 endangered (Cites listed) trees, like Mahogany, Rosewood and Cocobolo. Our unique collection of heirloom cacao is a testament to the 2,500 year-old Mayan practice of growing and cultivating cacao. 

Risks & Challenges

We have been working in the tropics for a long time and we've learned a lot over the years.  That said, this is agriculture and there is always an element of risk.  If for some reason, we can't send you cacao nibs immediately (be it for any number of reasons) we'll do our very best to send it to you as soon as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us financially, help us spread the word!  Not only do we want to promote sustainable farming practices, we also want to expand our friend-network!

story:
One of the most interesting birds in the Pacific Northwest is the amazing Great Gray Owl, and the Rogue Valley Audubon Society of southwest Oregon is sponsoring a project which is dedicated to building and installing nest platforms in suitable habitat for this remarkable bird.

Donations to the project will used to cover the cost of materials and to employ a skilled forester who must climb at least 35 feet in a conifer to install the nest platforms.

Great Gray Owls, the longest owl species in North America at more than 26 inches, rely on existing structures for nest locations.  They will lay eggs on cliff sides, in open tree cavities, and in old nests built by other bird species.  Because many of these nest sites are short-lived and/or difficult to locate, the Great Gray Owl population in any given area may be severely restricted by the limited availability of suitable nest sites.

Optimal conditions for Great Gray Owls are dense, mature forests with adjacent meadows where the birds will hunt both at night and during portions of the day.

With the placement of the man-made nest platforms (which the birds readily accept) at locations in the Cascade Mountains and in the Applegate Valley, Great Gray Owls will have greatly increased nesting opportunities.  Some existing nest platforms have been used by Great Gray Owl pairs for more than ten years.

Your contributions will help to insure that this fascinating species will continue to thrive and that their population will increase in the Pacific Northwest.

story:
Black Cats & Old Dogs Animal Rescue is made up of a group of volunteers who are dedicated to saving the lives of animals that other rescue groups often refuse. We do not discriminate against color, size, breed, or behavioral issues. We believe that every shelter animal deserves a chance. We are currently a registered non-profit with the State of Florida and 501(c)(3) pending with the IRS.

Black Cats & Old Dogs Animal Rescue was founded in January 2015 by Arianne Titsworth. She chose this name after repeatedly seeing wonderful animals get left behind by rescues due to things that the animals themselves could not control. She was infuriated that black kittens were not even given a second look- the shelters were literally killing them because they were black and no rescue would accept them. Wonderful dogs were killed for not liking other dogs, and both cats and dogs that were just simply terrified in cages- not even given a chance. Arianne knew she had to do something about this terrible reality, so she started her own rescue. In just 5 months, Arianne and her team of dedicated volunteers have saved over 150 cats and dogs from high kill shelters in Florida and Georgia. Our team never envisioned that we could save so many lives in such a short amount of time. What started out as a very small rescue, is turning into a large venture.

As you can imagine, rescuing 150+ animals is not a cheap endeavor. These cats and dogs need a place to stay, food, water, toys, training, and most importantly, vet care. Very few of our rescues come to us with any vetting whatsoever. Many animals come to us with various illnesses and parasites and are in need of immediate treatment.

Recently, Arianne and her team have decided to create a rescue center for Black Cats & Old Dogs. We have located a property that could serve as not only a place for adopters to come and meet their next family member, but also a place to house our animals. This is essential to our operation. It is extremely difficult to find dedicated fosters, especially long term fosters. This property was originally used as a breeding facility and we would absolutely love to turn it into the opposite- a sanctuary and adoption center for rescue animals. This property is situated on 6.38 quiet acres and include a home, two separate kennels, a chicken coup, and an almost completely fenced yard. Getting this property would also allow us to take on farm animal rescues! The absolute best thing about this property, is the price, a mere $59,900! Can you imagine? We could literally save thousands of animals over the next few years, IF we can acquire this property.

Our goals for this property include:

1. To have space to safely quarantine cats and dogs

2. To have a dedicated cat room for adoptable cats

3. To have space to take death row dogs & cats at the last minute

4. To have areas where we can safely rehabilitate dog aggressive dogs

5. To have classes & camps to teach children how to care for animals

6. To expand and be able to rescue horses, chickens, cows, pigs, goats and other farm animals

7. To allow people to come meet our animals at their convenience

8. To have space for mama cats & dogs to safely raise their babies

9. To act as a sanctuary for animals that are un-adoptable, such as dogs with terminal illnesses

This property is in great shape, but it does need some work. A large portion of the roof on the home needs to be repaired as well as the sub floor in the bathroom. We will also need to add fencing on some parts of the property, change the doggy doors to larger ones, and buy enough bedding for every cat and dog kennel. We are setting this fundraiser at $70,000 so that we can get everything accomplished in the beginning and concentrate solely on the animals after purchase. Please help Arianne and her team make this dream a reality and make a donation today. Every dollar puts us closer to our goal. Wouldn't you like to be part of something amazing?

Getting this property would also allow us to take on farm animal rescues! The absolute best thing about this property, is the price, a mere $59,900! Can you imagine? To have a dedicated cat room for adoptable cats3.	To have space to take death row dogs & cats at the last minute4.	To have areas where we can safely rehabilitate dog aggressive dogs5.	To have classes & camps to teach children how to care for animals6.	To expand and be able to rescue horses, chickens, cows, pigs, goats and other farm animals7.	To allow people to come meet our animals at their convenience8.	To have space for mama cats & dogs to safely raise their babies9. To act as a sanctuary for animals that are un-adoptable, such as dogs with terminal illnesses This property is in great shape, but it does need some work. A large portion of the roof on the home needs to be repaired as well as the sub floor in the bathroom. We will also need to add fencing on some parts of the property, change the doggy doors to larger ones, and buy enough bedding for every cat and dog kennel. We are setting this fundraiser at $70,000 so that we can get everything accomplished in the beginning and concentrate solely on the animals after purchase. Please help Arianne and her team make this dream a reality and make a donation today. Every dollar puts us closer to our goal. Wouldn't you like to be part of something amazing?

story:
Virtual Museum of Underwater Cultural Heritage

What is this? A campaign for a research project on nautical archaeology of Turkey

Who are we? As members, volunteers and supporters of Underwater Research Society of Turkey, we are research divers from all over Turkey. Since 2007, we have been looking for shipwrecks, sunken harbors, any trace of ancient cultures. So far, we found 7 ancient shipwrecks and more than 700 archaeological objects along the Lycian coast of Turkey.

Why do we need money? For doing research! We got a last minute approval for our research permission, and it was already too late for academic grant applications and sponsorship. Volunteers cover their own expenses (travel food) but we need a boat to reach the shipwrecks.

Why do I donate money? For experiencing the 3D virtual tours to these shipwrecks or any other reason that you feel comfortable with.

Who I am? Dive Instructor (PADI, CMAS), architect, academician, nautical archaeologist. I studied in, took certificates from METU, Bilkent and ITU (Turkey) and TAMU and UCLA (US) and NAS (UK). 

When do you start? Our field project starts in November 16th in Turkey. After we are done gathering underwater data, we have few months to finish the web application/ implementations of these shipwrecks.

I am an academician and I need more fancy explanation about your project?

Here you are...

Museum without walls:

The museum is considered to be the ideal place for the highest level of preservation for cultural heritage. However, separated from its context, isolated from its meaning; the cultural heritage of various spaces and time is enclosed in a single place, a heterotopian space as defined by Foucault. After the advent of digital technologies, the meaning of museum has shifted using the virtuality, giving birth to a new concept of virtual museum. In the digital domain, peculiarities of museum, library and archive have merged into each other. As opposed to brick and mortar versions, these institutions are liberated in many aspects. Referring to Malraux, the digital heritage has become a separate
entity, detached from its original context, bringing new opportunities to the digital heritage data. In this specific example on underwater cultural heritage data, the musealization of nautical archaeology will both create a reference data for further academic researches and promote the dissemination of underwater cultural heritage. To accomplish this aim, this project proposes a framework of a virtual museum that incorporates the practices of collection, preservation, research, visualization and exhibit, thus offers new approaches to the preservation of cultural heritage.


Sualti Kultur Mirasi Sanal Muzesi

Ben Güzden. Bu mesaj size ulaşıyorsa siz veya yakın çevrenizden birisi projelerimize katılmıştır ya da sizi deniz, çevre ve tarih koruma konularında duyarlı birisi olarak görüyordur.

Kendimi tanıtayım. Mimar, dalgıç, sivil toplum kuruluşu üyesi, arkeolog, sualtı korumacı... ODTÜ, Bilkent, Texas A&M, İTÜ, UCLA gibi kurumlarda dirsek çürüttüm ve son 15 senedir de ODTÜ-SAT ve SAD (Sualtı Araştırmaları Derneği) üyesiyim. 1997'den beri sualtında, 2006 yılından beri ise Kaş'ta sualtı araştırmaları yapan bir avuç Don Kişot'un yanında, başında ve arkasında yer aldım. Yıllardır, kıyılarda ve sualtıda bulunan arkeolojik eserleri araştırmak, bulmak, incelemek, tanıtmak ve bu mirası ulusal ve uluslararası çevrelere anlatmak için hem Türkiye'de hem yurtdışında kapı kapı dolaşıyorum.

TÜBİTAK, TÜBA, Avrupa Birliği, Dünya Bankası, ARIT, AKMED ve benzeri kurumlardan fonlar aldım, alamadığımda da cebimden harcadım.

Şimdiye kadar büyük bir aileydik. 500'e yakın kişi gönüllü projemizde daldı, batık buldu, fotoğraf çekti, araziye gelemediyse de bilgisayar başından yardım etti.

Aynı zamanda çoğu avcılığa ve yer yer rekreasyonel dalışa dahi kapalı koruma alanı da olan dünyaca ünlü Patara - Kekova bölgesinin, eşsiz sualtı kültür mirasını yerinde keşif ve belgeleyerek, hiç dokunmadan sayısallaştırıp, internet üzerinden erişilen bir sanal müze haline getirmek için çalışmaktayız. 2007'de başlayan projemiz her yıl ilgili kurumların onaylarıyla birlikte etap etap ilerlemekte.

Ne var ki bu sene sadece 8 kişiyiz.

2013 yılı arazi çalışması için Kültür ve Turizm Bakanlığı izin ve onaylarımız iki yıllık uzun bir bekleyişten sonra maalesef sonbaharın ilk günlerinde geldi. Yani gönüllülerimizin çoğunun takım elbiselerini giydiği mesailerine kesin dönüş yapmak durumunda olduğu, suların da dalış için son derece elverişsizleştiği bir dönemde.

Dahası bu iznin 2013 bitmeden kullanılması gerekmekte. Aksi durum, projemizin önümüzdeki etaplarını da olumsuz etkileyeceğinden; video ve fotoğraf makinalarımız, dalış malzemelerimiz, bu malzemenin hakkını sonuna kadar verecek, gönüllü ekibimizin işlerinden güçlerinden izin alabilen en kahramanları ile birlikte 9-17 Kasım'da Kaş'tayız.

6 senelik araştırmada bulduğumuz 7 batık gün yüzüne çıkmak için bizi bekliyor.

Görüntülerimizi alıp size internetten sunacağız.

Ancak ekibimizin ufak iki eksiği var batıklarımız, yüzerek gidemeyeceğimiz uzaklıkta ve proje süresi de aç ve susuz geçiremeyeceğimiz kadar uzun. Tekne kiralamamız ve günüllülerimizin karınlarını doyurmamız gerekiyor.

Ufak desteklerinizle bu sualtı mirasını gün yüzüne taşıyacağız ve size internet üzerinden sunmakla kalmayacak, bir yandan da UCLA'deki http://hypercities.ats.ucla.edu/ projesine katılan ilk sualtı ekibi olma öncülüğünü gerçekleştireceğiz.

Sizin için belki küçük, ancak bizim için muazzam desteklerinizle...

Proje Tarihçesi

Kaş Arkeopark Deneysel Arkeoloji Projesi (2006) ile dünyanın en eski batığı Uluburun arkeolojik kazı alanı ve, ULUBURUN III isimli gemi canlandırılmaları yerel destekler, belediye ve kaymakamlık destekleri ile sualtına yerleştirilmiştir.

Türkiye Sualtı Kültür Mirası Sanal Müzesi: Kaş Arkeopark Pilot Projesi (2007) ile internet ortamında bu alan TÜBİTAK desteği ile tanıtılmış, Erkut Arcak Kaş Arkeopark Bilim Kampı (2008-2011) ile ulusal boyutta TÜBİTAK NAS ve Avrupa Birliği destekli bir eğitim programı ile yeni nesil korumacı - araştırmacı bilim adamı adayları yetiştirilmiş, Sualtı Kültür Mirası (2008-2011) ile bölgedeki arkeolojik buluntular TÜBİTAK, ARİT, AKMED destekleri ve İSKEN sponsorluğunda tespit edilmiştir. Yöre gençlerini hedef alan Genç Arkeopark (2010) Avrupa Birliği projesi ile, bilim insanı adaylarının eğitimine yönelik Kaş Tarihtir (2011) Dünya Bankası projeleri de tamamlanmıştır.

2013 yılında ise Sanal Müze projesi ile, Türkiye’nin sualtı kültür envanterinin sayısal ortamda canlandırılmasına yönelik bir internet platformu yaratılacaktır. Türkiye kıyılarında sualtı kültür hazinesi, ileri teknoloji cihazlarla görüntülenerek, zenginleştirilmiş görsellerle oluşturulan sanal müzede yer alacaktır. University of California Los Angeles (UCLA) ve İstanbul Teknik Üniversitesi (İTÜ) ortaklığında, Kültür ve Turizm Bakanlığı izni ile yürütülmekte olan bu projemiz, akademik olarak TÜBA (Türkiye Bilimler Akademisi) tarafından, lojistik olarak Kaş Belediyesi ve Kaş Kaymakamlığı tarafından desteklenmektedir. Tüba tarafından ekipman desteği bu sene için tamamlanmıştır. Senelerin deneyimine sahip gönüllü olarak projeye katılacaktır.

story:
Short Summary

Hello,

My name is Marko Ristovski and i am from Uzice, Serbia. I am graduated manager in hospitality industry and tourist guide.

I am fighting for eco-tourism development in Western Serbia and as a base for it i opened first Eco Hostel in Serbia in September 2013. After working all around the world and gaining knowledge and experience i came back in my home town in Serbia to start this eco-tourism development project.

After very bad year for tourism with 2 months of floods and 8 sunny days in whole season we run out of savings that were meant to keep the hostel running until June. Now after we build a brand, web site and worldwide recognition and after we brought eco oriented guests from 50 different countries in our city we are facing with closing because we can not keep up with all costs that we have have to pay to go through low season and cold winter.

By helping this project you will contribute to development of small city of Užice in Western Serbia and his region. Eco Hostel here came as a new hope for tourism development in this region where arrival of new tourists contribute to many small businesses run by the local families.

What We Need & What You Get

To keep the hostel alive until June when season starts we need 3000 $. This money will be used to cover rent because we are not the owners of the place and we are renting it for 500$ per month.

Platinum, Diamond and Gold Perks will be in occasion to experience this unique place and eco trips that we organize. Silver perks and friends will be promoted on our social networks and web sites as contributor to eco-tourism development idea in Western Serbia. 

The Impact

Eco Hostel Republik is first hostel of that kind in Serbia and with implemented green practices hostel minimize impact on the environment and helps the spreading eco awareness in Serbia. 

Business concept implemented in Eco Hostel Republik is applicable everywhere in the world and its created in order to reduce carbon footprint on the earth, preserve the water consumption, force upcycling materials for furniture, renewable energy resources, biodegradable chemicals and green way of travelling by using green way on transportation. 

Eco Hostel Republik won many prizes as an innovative and green oriented project which have multiple benefits for local community as wall as environment protection. 

This concept and marketing used for this hostel became very well promoted and there are some people who already contacted me to give them right to open Eco Hostel Republik in some other cities. There is a pending request from one entrepreneur from Thessaloniki Grece and one from Kragujevac,Serbia so this project have tendency to became global and well excepted by the travelers.

Risks & Challenges

Eco Hostel Republik project and eco-tourism development started brave in maybe worst period of time when Serbia experienced worst floods in history and in the city with amazing touristic potential which had a problem with drinking water for almost a month.

It will be a big challenge to keep the hostel open until summer in order to bring more people in Užice and Western Serbia.


Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate if you spread a word about Eco Hostel Republik and if you point this project to people who can help us out. The best way will be to use the indiegogo social tools.

We will be happy to see you at our place and don't forget to bring some friends with you.

story:
I need help to get this beauty on the road and out of the landfill. I've been working od the rebuild of this van for 4 summers now In Sept 2013 I finished the body work (wheel wells all around and some other panel patches). Then I stripped the paint and went down to bare metal (lots of work there).

Winter in Winnipeg makes it impossible to work in an unheated garage so in Spring of 2014 I started to prep the body and paint. Everything was going well and it looked like the old beast would see the road again soon.
Then in late June My garage door was ripped apart and all of my tools were stolen.
Talk about losing momentum. And of course I had no insurance,my bad.
So now the bus is sitting frozen in a leaky garage, only the drivers side has paint and the rest is developing a thin veneer of surface rust. That won't be a big deal if I can work on it in the spring.
Mechanically the bus is fine, engine works great.
My life hasn't been the best in the last few years. I am totally freelance with no safety net and in recent history I've had my hip replaced and been unable to work for 3 years due to a shoulder injury. I'm by no means complaining, lots of folk have it far worst than me. I just have no resources  to re-equip myself with so I am appealing to the world for some help.
I also will totally use the tools to help anybody else in the VW community ( or pretty much anybody that needs mechanical help).
I should mention that I'm not a mechanic, I'm a stagehand, but I'm handy :) .

story:
Overview

With your help, US-based leaders from Young Evangelicals for Climate Action (Y.E.C.A.) will have the opportunity to uniquely support our partners at the Congo Initiative-Université Chrétienne Bilingue du Congo (UCBC) as they develop climate change action plans for their campus and communities in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo.  


Why the Democratic Republic of Congo?

The Democratic Republic of Congo sustains the second largest rainforest in the world. This forest acts as a critical carbon sink and climate regulator, affecting rainfall patterns and weather as far away as North America and Europe (Nkem et al 2008 and WWF). The magnitude of this effect suggests that the success or failure of environmental stewardship in the Congo will substantially impact our planet’s health in the coming decades. Therefore, while the Congo faces ongoing challenges from competing domestic and international interests, local indigenous leadership has been growing in response to these challenges in order to achieve peace, security, and stability.

Founded in 2007, the Congo Initiative-Université Chrétienne Bilingue du Congo (UCBC), in Beni, Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) meets the need for indigenous leadership by providing its students with a transformative education that encourages service learning, innovative action, character formation, and academic rigor. It is UCBC students who are paving a new way forward at the intersection of environmental sustainability, economic development and community wellbeing.


Where does Y.E.C.A. come in?

In May 2014, Y.E.C.A. entered into an exciting partnership with UCBC to support, train and equip young leaders around climate action.  Over the past year, our inaugural UCBC Climate Leadership Fellows, Sifa Jolie and Faden, have led incredible initiatives to build climate change awareness on their campus, as well as to promote composting, recycling and renewable energy on their campus and in their community. See their mid-year report here: Fellows Mid-Year Report.

While our fellows have been doing phenomenal work, there has been a vocalized need for more advanced natural science training among the larger UCBC community. In addition to UCBC’s own efforts to connect with environmental organizations in the region, Y.E.C.A. has facilitated relationships between UCBC and larger creation care networks throughout East Africa. One of the outcomes of these budding relationships is the opportunity for a team of nine UCBC students, faculty and staff to travel to Kenya during the month of May, and they have invited the Y.E.C.A. team to accompany them during this time of training.

(Climate Fellows Faden and Sifa Jolie)


What’s Happening this Summer?

From May 14-June 8, 2015, four Y.E.C.A. Steering Committee members hope to further develop our partnership with UCBC and reconnect with our Congolese Climate Leadership Fellows during a three part trip in East Africa. We have been invited by a UCBC team of creation care and climate change leaders to join them as they:

  1. Establish relationships with other regional creation care leaders at the Lausanne Creation Care and the Gospel Conference in Nairobi, Kenya

  2. Engage in natural science training at A Rocha Kenya’s Science Field Study Center in Malindi, Kenya

  3. Develop and implement creation care and climate action plans for their campus and local communities in and around Beni, DRC.


What is the Lausanne Creation Care Network?

Just in case you thought there weren’t enough acronyms floating around, the Lausanne Creation Care Network (LCCN) embodies the global creation care efforts of organizations like A Rocha International, Care of Creation, and World Evangelical Alliance.  LCCN is organizing regional conferences in many regions of the world in a globally-focused campaign to jumpstart and reinvigorate nations to implement creation care projects.  This May we will join students, pastors, seminary professors, and Christian leaders from various organizations and churches across East and Central Africa “to learn how a biblically-based approach to creation care can play an important role in discipleship and holistic development.” During the last day of the conference, participants will gather with others from their nation to form national plans that faithfully address creation care opportunities and challenges.


What is the team doing at A Rocha Kenya?

A Rocha Kenya (ARK) is a Christian conservation organization which was established on the Kenyan coast in 1999. A Rocha is committed to environmental action through community conservation projects. The team will be staying at Mwamba, ARK’s field study center, to learn practical lessons from A Rocha’s ongoing conservation projects. In addition to learning from the staff at A Rocha Kenya, the UCBC climate leaders and fellows will be spending focused time together as a group, and drawing from the experience of the YECA steering committee members, will form a creation care and climate action plan to take back to their campus and community in Congo.  The team has specifically requested training in the areas of:

  • Waste management and compost production

  • Conservation agriculture and agroforestry

  • Ecotourism

It will be a time for growth; moving from a biblical understanding of the importance of creation care into practical, obedient, transforming action in their lives and the lives of their neighbors.


How will we accompany the team in Beni, DRC?

Building off of our existing relationships with many students, faculty and staff at UCBC, the YECA team will have the opportunity to support the initial implementation of the creation care and climate action plans developed by the UCBC leaders during their time in Kenya. This may specifically include co-leading trainings to the larger campus community on topics such as sustainability, the theology of creation care, and introductory environmental science. We will also be able to spend strategic time with our Climate Leadership Fellows and engage in person their work on campus and in the local community. By walking with them through their typical school day, we can help our fellows identify ongoing areas for partnership and support.


How can YOU help?

As discussed above, our Climate Leadership Fellows and other creation care leaders from UCBC have invited us to join them in Kenya and DRC for this critical period of leadership training. We are committed to making this happen, however, Y.E.C.A. is a young organization and limited in its ability to self-fund large travel expenses. Despite these limitations, we are eager to invest our time into our fellows and partners at UCBC by joining them during the trip. We would be honored if you joined us as financial partners in our efforts! Here is the breakdown of how we will be using the funds that are raised:

  • $4,446 - Flights to and from as well as within East Africa

  • $2,365 - Room and Board in Kenya, Uganda, and Democratic Republic of Congo

  • $795 - Visas - Kenya, Uganda Transit Visa, Democratic Republic of Congo

  • $775 - Ground Transportation

  • $156 - Training and experiential learning opportunities

Total = $8,537

Any money that we raise over our goal, or that goes unused during the trip, will go directly into the Y.E.C.A. Climate Fellows Fund, which will support our current and future cohorts of climate activists in the DR Congo.

More important than the raising of funds for the trip is the support of your prayers. As a Christian organization, we at Y.E.C.A. believe that faithfully trusting in God’s providence is central to all of our initiatives.  Specifically for this trip, please pray for:

  • Safe travel for Y.E.C.A. steering committee members and the UCBC team

  • Strong friendships and partnerships to develop between members of different organizations and between people of varied backgrounds and nationalities

  • That we would be attentive listeners, receptive to the needs, wants, and questions of the UCBC team as they consider what it looks like to live as faithful stewards in their context

  • Humility and trust in God as the Y.E.C.A. and UCBC teams seek to address the increasingly immense issue of climate change


Who are you supporting?

Y.E.C.A. Team Profiles:

Ben Lowe

  • I’m currently on staff with the Evangelical Environmental Network (EEN) where I work on outreach and am the spokesperson for Young Evangelicals for Climate Action. Last year I had the opportunity to participate as a facilitator at UCBC’s Campus Conversations week on Creation Care and initiate the development of our inaugural cohort of Climate Leadership Fellows at UCBC. Deeply invested in Y.E.C.A.’s relationship with UCBC, I am looking forward to learning from our partners as we engage the theology, study and practice of creation care.

Brittany Ederer

  • I currently serve as the Global Campaign Administrator for the Lausanne Creation Care Network, and will help orient both the UCBC and Y.E.C.A. teams at the East and Central Africa Creation Care and the Gospel Conference in Nairobi.  A wildlife ecologist by training, I hope to learn much from our Congolese partners, and encourage them in practical ways during our time in the DRC.

Andrew Kinzer

  • Before moving to Michigan for my wife to attend graduate school, we lived and worked with A Rocha Kenya, a Christian conservation organization located on Kenya’s coast. All of the conservation and sustainable development work I have been involved in has been in the East African context. I am excited to serve as a facilitator between these two groups of people; our friends from UCBC, and my close friends and former colleagues at A Rocha Kenya.

Rachel Lamb

  • I am a recent graduate of the University of Maryland, College Park where I studied Conservation Biology, Sustainable Development and Public Policy at the graduate level. In May 2014, I had the privilege of joining the UCBC community for their Campus Conversations week on Creation Care, and quickly began to seek out ways that Y.E.C.A. could further partner with them around creation care and climate action. Having developed strong relationships with our Congolese fellows, I am looking forward to reuniting with them.


A Personalized and Meaningful Thank You

As a symbol of gratitude from both the Y.E.C.A. and UCBC teams we will be writing personal notes to each supporter of this trip!  In addition, for partners who donate at higher levels we will be purchasing handmade kikoy sarongs and local coffee, tea or honey from Kenya.  We hope that these tokens of appreciation remind our supporters to pray for the critical climate activism work being done in Congo and Kenya.


Please consider sharing our story with your friends and family!!

Check out our other projects at YECAction.org

story:
*english version of the text lower on the page:

The Better Bottle Project:

Mon nom est Alexis de Tarade, je suis né en France d’une mère grecque et j’ai grandi aux États-Unis. J’ai travaillé dans les médias et la communication visuelle pendant plusieurs années mais au fil des ans j’ai commencé à me sentir de plus en plus concerné par l’écologie. Je ne suis pas un scientifique mais j’essaie de me servir de mes compétences en arts visuels et de ma motivation pour faire la différence. Je ne peux tout simplement plus supporter de juste me plaindre dans mon coin et regarder l’environnement se dégrader sans participer à sa sauvegarde. 

Je me suis installé à Annecy il y a deux ans et j’ai voulu m’impliquer pour aider à garder le lac propre et préservé. J’ai été assez frustré de voir que les solutions actuelles de recyclages ou d’alimentation bio posent tout de même un problème environnementale à cause des emballages que ça génère et qui la plupart du temps finissent hors de la chaîne de tri avec les autres déchets. J’ai alors cherché la source du problème La réduction des emballages semble être une des solutions de base.
En ville on peut facilement voir que les touristes comme les locaux achètent des bouteilles qui sont souvent remplis par de l’eau qui vient de la région, comme Evian par exemple. La qualité de l’eau courante à Annecy est comparable à l’eau minérale vendue dans le commerce, alors qu’elle est en libre accès et fraiche dans de nombreuses fontaines à travers la ville. La question qui se posait alors était « comment amener les gens à prendre l’habitude de ré-utiliser une bouteille en verre lorsqu’ils sont à Annecy ? » la Better Bottle est la réponse.

Les contributeurs au projet nous donnerons les moyens à mon équipe et moi pour produire la Better Bottle, une bouteille de type bouteille de limonade à l’ancienne à remplir aux points d’eau qui seront recensés sur une carte spécialement créée et distribuée avec la bouteille. On espère pas seulement distribuer les bouteilles mais aussi participer au nettoyage de la ville et des berges du lac pour s’assurer qu’une plus grande quantité des déchets de la ville puissent être recyclés.

La carte:

Les Frais & comment nous aider: 

Nous avons besoin de au moins $3000  pour fabriquer 500 bouteilles, se procurer un bateau  de nettoyage et un vélo de facteur avec sa remorque pour transporter les déchets recyclables qu’on aura collecté. J’ai également intégré dans le calcul de l’argent pour rémunérer un minimum l’équipe de jeunes pour les longues journées au soleil passées à distribuer nos Better Bottle, à nettoyer les plages et à mettre les mains dans les poubelles.

Coûts:

  • 500 Bottles (minimum production run) : $1000 

    Matériel et rémunération de l’équipe : 650 $

    Canoë 3 personnes d’occasion pour le nettoyage des fonds : 650 $

    Vélo de transport des bouteilles : 550 $

  • Frais Indiegogo : 350 $

Recompenses au contribut:

Nous espérons vraiment ne pas devoir dépendre de la vente des Better Bottle aux touristes. L’efficacité de cette campagne viendra du fait que nous offrirons les bouteilles aux gens. Qui dira non si c’est gratuit ? Nous seront ouverts aux dons, cela relève du choix des personnes mais pendant toute la durée de la campagne il y aura plusieurs sortes de goodies avec les logos Better Bottle à vendre, et selon la contribution Indiegogo, vous pourrez vous en voir offrir. (Nous vous contacterons par e-mail pour votre adresse postale pour envoyer les produits une fois que nous sommes prêts à expédier en Août.)

Autocollant Better Bottle:

La Bouteille Better Bottle:

Sac en Cotton Bio:



T-shirt en Cotton Bio:Même si nous n’atteignons pas notre but sur Indiegogo, le projet verra le jour quand même. Même avec nos propres moyens, vélos, nous ferons notre possible pour produire et distribuer un maximum de bouteilles en collectant un maximum de déchets recyclables. À ce moment là nous serons forcés de faire un appel aux dons mais je crois que la clé du succès de ce projet se trouve dans la gratuité et la participation spontanée des gens à qui on offrira ces Better Bottle et que l’on pourra sensibiliser. L’eau doit rester gratuite.


Nous pourrions également avoir recours au sponsoring de commerçants locaux qui pourraient acheter des encarts publicitaires sur le vélo et la carte des points d’eau mais TOUT les profits iront au projet et ne constitueront en aucun cas des revenus pour nous.

Si de l’argent venait à s’accumuler il sera reversé à des associations de protection de l’environnement comme la LPO (www.birdlife.org) et la FRAPNA (www.frapna.org) qui travaillent pour apporter une eau propre aux populations.

L’impact de la Better Bottle:

  • On essaie de résoudre le problème des déchets à la source. Les produits recyclables doivent être triés et jetés aux bons endroits, hors on peut voir que même pour les gens qui sont sensibles aux recyclage et le pratique chez eux, une fois en ville ou loin de chez eux très peu font l’impasse car peu saven où recycler  et il devient difficile de garder les bonnes habitudes.



    Une seule Better Bottle peut faire la différence pour une personne, il est facile d’imaginer la différence que cela ferait si l’on pouvait en produire 500 ou même plus !


    Prochaine étape:

D’ici l’été prochain nous espérons rendre le projet Better Bottle officiel auprès de la Mairie d’Annecy, fort de son soutien et de celui des commerçants locaux le projet pourrait prendre de l’ampleur voire s’exporter dans d’autres endroits où l’on vit au bord de l’eau. Si vous aimez l’idée, ne vous gênez pour faire la même chose chez vous, nous serons heureux de vous aider.

Si vous n’avez pas d’argent pour participer au financement, vous avez toujours une voix et le partage de notre projet est déjà une bonne chose, et nous savons que vous avez une bouteille de verre vide chez vous, alors rejoignez le mouvement et buvez votre eau local et motivent tous les gents de remplacer les bouteilles en plastiques avec un Better Bottle!

N’hésitez pas à utiliser les outils de partage d’Indiegogo pour les réseaux sociaux.

Un grand MERCI!

-The Better Bottle Project


The Better Bottle idea: (english version)

  • My name is Alexis de Tarade, born in France from a Greek mother and grew up in the USA. I have worked in media for many years but with age I have become more and more concerned about ecology. Since I am not a scientist I am trying to use my visual arts skills and self-motivation to help make a difference. I simply  cannot stand on the sidelines anymore complaining and watching the environment crumble without participating towards its salvation. I moved to Annecy two years ago and decided to do something to help keep the lake clean and pure.

    I was frustrated with the current solutions such as organic food and recyclables since they often fall short of achieving a better planet due to their packaging. I wanted to get to the source of the problem and reduce the packaging being created in the first place. I noticed in town that locals and tourists were buying bottled water while living quite close from their source, like Evian. The water quality in town is comparable to bottled water and is offered free and fresh all over town via public fountains. The question was, "How to get the people to acquire the habit of re-using a glass bottle while in Annecy?". The Better Bottle was the answer.

    The contributors towards the project will give us the means for my team and I to produce the Better Bottle, a glass lemonade bottle, to be distributed to the people and refilled at one of the many watering points marked on the map provided. We hope to not only distribute the bottles, but help clean up the lake and make sure more recyclable material is actually recycled.


    The map:
    (the map will be updated with further information at the time of production)


How to Help Us & Rewards:

  • We will need be about $3000 to make at least 500 bottles, get the canoe for lake clean-ups and the bike/trailer to transport the recyclable goods that we collect and dispose of correctly. Then I have calculated some money to feed and provide some minimal renumeration to the small team for long days in the sun distributing bottles, cleaning up the beaches and digging through the trash. 

    COSTS:
     
    500 Bottles (minimum production run) : $1000 

    Materials & crew costs: $650

     3 person second-hand canoe: $650

    Bottle transport vehicle: $550

  • Indiegogo Payment: $350


     Rewards to our contributers:

  • We are really hoping to not depend on finding funds by selling bottles to the tourists. The effectiveness of this campaign will be in the fact that we are offering the bottle to people. Who will say no to a free bottle of water? If they want to give us a donation, that will be their choice but we intend to gather funds by selling the goodies with Better Bottle graphics. (We will contact you via email for your mailing address once we are ready to ship all the goods in August.)

    Sticker:


    Bottle:


    Organic Cotton Bag:


    Organic Cotton T-shirt:
  • Even if we fall short of our Indigogo goal, we are going to do this project anyway. It might just end up being us on our bikes riding around cleaning up what we can and making as many bottles that the money collected will allow us to make. At this point we will be obliged to ask for donations when we distribute the bottles, but we believe the success in the project will be if we can offer people the bottles and revenues can be made on shirts & bags instead. The water must remain FREE in Annecy.
  • Local businesses can buy advertisement to be place on the trailer of the bike and on the map but ALL profits will be only feeding back into the project and never to accumulate revenue. 

    If any superfluous funds are accumulated we plan to donate it to local preservation societies like the LPO (www.birdlife.org) & FRAPNA (www.frapna.org) and efforts that are working to bring clean water to people. 

    The Impact of The Better Bottle:
    We are trying to plug the trash problem at the source, plastic bottles. Recyclable packaging is in vain if they all end of in landfills because people don't bother to recycle or don't know where to recycle. Many people recycle and are mindful of the environment but when away from home on holidays it can be hard to keep their good habits.

    1 Better Bottle can make such a difference with one person. Imagine the difference we can do with 500 bottles or even more!

    The Next Step:
  •  We hope to eventually approach the town of Annecy and try to make this project official and backed by the town and local commerces. We are only working through the second half of this summer but all the material will be used next year for the bigger better project with the support of the town, hopefully. The project can be exported to wherever bountiful clean water exists and to help keep it that way. If you you like the idea, feel free to launch it in your area. We will be happy to give you any suggestions.

If you don't have money to help, at least you a have voice:

  • If you are low on funds, we understand. Just help repost and share the project. We know you have a resealable empty glass bottle somewhere around your house so you can join the movement by drinking your local water. Let people know it's time we end the decades of plastics sitting in our soils and seas.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share on social networks.
  • We are filming our efforts all summer to submit to ARTE to be part of the CLIMATE OPS collaborative documentary that will be presented before the United Nations Conference on Climate Change in Paris this fall. More details:  http://info.arte.tv/en/climate-ops

A big green THANKS for helping us. Wish us luck and do what you can on your side of the lake to keep this planet clean!
